text: What a surprise! Came here from a recommendation by a friend, and it lived up to it's rep. It's got a nice, trendy, modern sort of atmosphere, and combined with tasty Thai fusion (I don't know if I'd call it 100% traditional) - it's a definite hit!  We'll be back again
I love this restaurant!  It might be my new favorite in Vegas. I have brought two of my foodie friends and they both LOVED the food!  The crispy duck panang is just awesome !
Dwayne is really great and the food is excellent!!! So delicious every time! The spring rolls are my favorite. It's a small place so service is always great. Chada is a hidden gem.
Its my Lotus of Siam on the Westside, but much less crowded.  Drunken noodles, pad thai, coconut crab curry and lettuce wraps were all delicious.  Great, attentive service.

I still love this place but I had a couple small issues with my last visit.  I ordered my favorite dish, the fried prawns with curry, and something new, the duck curry.  The prawns were amazing as usual until I reached for the last prawn at the bottom.  It smelled really  foul and was blatantly bad.  It's forgivable but it was very unpleasant.  The duck curry was very good however, it was very small .  It was portioned as an appetizer and was lacking for a $20+ entree.   Still one of the greatest in town but it cost them a star in my book.
GET THE DUCK PANANG. service is a bit slow, could've been better... food makes up for it!

First to arrive at 6 PM on Sunday. Quite a few more tables seated by the time we left. Nice decor, good service. More wine than you'd expect for a Thai restaurant at least as I know.

Compared to other Thai restaurants the flavors veer much toward sour and tangy much to my delight. Even the spice level was heat but much more than one note. The sweet and oily tastes that are normally very prevalent were more undertones. Usually I finish a plate of Thai food and there is greasy sauce on the plate. I love it when there is not.

My favorite - the lettuce wraps so flavorful with a tamarind sauce. The crab was overwhelmed but the other flavors made up for it. The rib eye salad was good with a lot of fish sauce as long as you like that. The stir fried pork was ground pork and I thought it would be pieces but good although surprising that it wasn't accompanied by rice or something - very spicy. I would definitely return. The sides were fresh and everything was presented with care.
Worst service,complete rational discrimination.I hate the lady who served us and her attitude towards us.I hate to give rating.
Amazing authentic thai, off the beaten track!  Small cozy restaurant, strongly recommend.
I had the best curry and fried prawns here! It was so delicious that I went back the next day and tried the crab curry. Both dishes were rich in seafood flavor and extremely satisfying!
Just the best, even better than Lotus. Great atmosphere and super wine list.

Fantastic food, fantastic service, and options to branch out or just enjoy a classic pad Thai dish. We got two orders of pad Thai, 2 appetizers, and two glasses of wine for $50 - so don't let the outside fool you when driving by :)

We are in town visiting and a server on the strip recommended this place. We had the duck rice, duck curry and crab curry. Everything was extremely good. The crab curry was HOT! We each had a pour of the Cabernet which paired well with the spice. We then split the coconut sorbet with sticky rice. If you're willing to venture off the strip, I highly recommend this place!

So I guess the biggest decision when it comes to Thai is whether to eat at Chada Thai or Lotus of Siam. I like the prices more at Chada and food is just as good. My recommendations include pad kra pow with pork belly, fresh oysters, and panang duck.  It is very comparable to the Thai in SF, NY, and Los Angeles ( which I think has the best thai in the country).  I didn't get to try their coconut with mango dessert because it wasn't in season. Eat there if you want Thai in Las Vegas, you won't be disappointed.

It was with great anticipation that we watched and waited for this place to open. We attended on opening night and noticed food critic, John Curtas, in the house. We were simultaneously intrigued by the tapas style concept yet apprehensive as well. In our experience, "tapas" often translates to expensive small portions. Unfortunately, the reality left much to be desired. Long story short, Chada Thai = overpriced small portions of mediocre food combined with subpar service. For our party of 3, we ordered about 10 dishes plus two $1 bowls of rice which cost us $80+ before tax/tip and we still left hungry. At most other Thai places, you could pay half that amount, leave stuffed silly, and it would taste better too. The "highlight" of the evening was how they handled the raw potato in the Massaman curry. When we brought it to the attention of the manager/owner(?), he asked if the chicken was cooked enough. When we replied yes, he just walked away and ignored the issue. There was no offer of redoing the dish, taking it off the bill, or offering any sort of discount. At the very LEAST, they should've offered to give us a properly cooked potato! Especially during these economic times, you need to offer customers value for their dollar: good food and decent portions at a reasonable price. This place offers neither and combines it with crappy service to boot. I don't see Chada Thai lasting very long unless it makes some dramatic changes to address its deficiencies.

This place is amazing! 

Good atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. This is the place you want to go if you want a slightly nicer Thai food experience. Food is going to be in the $25/plate range, but everything melts in your mouth. 

They are well known for their crispy duck and, if you try it, you'll know why. It is perfectly tender on the inside, deliciously crunchy on the outside. Seasoned just right, it is a dish definitely worth trying if you like duck. I usually get the drunken noodles with the crispy duck. 

This is a great spot for a Saturday night date or dinner and drinks with friends. Highly recommend it, you will not leave unhappy.

Wow, I've been here once before, but I was really impressed this time. Here are the standouts:
Larb - I know it's basically just ground pork, but the spices they use in this raise it to another level. Sweet, sour, and spicy.
Pad See Eiw - Definitely the best I've had. I didn't know Pad See Eiw could be so good.
Moo Hong - Pork belly that's soft, moist and melts in your mouth. The only complaint is that I wish the portion size was bigger on this one.
Duck Panang - Yelpers had this one right. The crispiness of the duck is the best part.

The other dishes we had, green curry, Pad Hed (mushrooms and brussel sprouts), and Yum Nua (beef salad), were all good too. The only dish I didn't like was the Kang Kua Kaduk Moo (braised pork ribs in some kind of turmeric spicy sauce)...I wasn't digging the sauce and the spiciness was kinda too much for me.

When I'm back in Vegas, I'll be paying Chada a visit over Lotus of Siam.
I would eat here regularly if I lived in Vegas -- delicious, fresh twist on Thai in an intimate, modern space. (Clean restroom is a big plus for me, too.)

This place rocks! Solid food, very well defined Flavors and textures. Fantastic wine program accentuated with Trocken Rieslings and beautiful Austrians. 
Service is great, big upper hand when compared to Lotus. Items recommended:
Crab curry
Quail eggs and dried shrimp
Beef Jerky
Pad Thai ( I know, maybe boring, but it's the main indicator of quality for me)

Don't be afraid to over order one or two dishes. The price allows to do that. 
Make reservations!

I love this cool thai place, definitely my fav. The duck is nice and crispy on the outside instead of oily. The pad thai was pretty original but tasty as most. The Pad Hen appetizer was amaaazing, full of flavor would order 2 orders for myself next time. Most reviewers seem to enjoy the spicy herb spring rolls but they were pretty average to me. I will definitely be back over and over again. I think their prices are fair since they have quality dishes. The restaurant itself is on the small size but with great decor which makes it intimate and a good place for a date. Enjoy!

Super small portions, and overly salty.  $60 for:

1. Thai Beef Jerky (this was super gross - basically salty beef deep fried to oblivion)
2. Mushroom, Brussels & Lotus Root
3. Chicken Thai Fried Rice
4. Chinese Broccoli Greens & Crispy Pork Belly
5. Crab Curry

You would think this is a lot of food for 2 adults, a 4 year old and a baby, but we left hungry.  Would not eat here again.

The waiter brings the chicken basil and drunken noodles, sits it down and leaves. So I call him over and ask him if the chicken basil comes with rice, he replies "no" and walks away. By the way the chicken basil was average but the drunken noodles were awful.
First time here with a friend and it's truly authentic thai, one of my new favorite thai spots

I've now found my favorite Thai restaurant here in Las Vegas. The Thai chili oysters on the half shell were amazing. Pad Kee Mao was add good as I've gotten anywhere back home (Seattle). Ill be back to test their Red Curry to see if this is my favorite Thai restaurant ever.

I'm surprised by the mediocre reviews, as I would argue that this is the best Thai in Vegas - easily  on par with Lotus of Siam food-wise, but with a stellar, affordable wine list and inviting ambiance.  Been here 3 times in 2 weeks and will be back again soon.  If you know food and love wine, this is your place.  Don't miss the crab curry...

The staff acts uppity and pretentious as they serve you tiny portions that are totally overpriced in a dark setting that has a handful of tables. Food was decent but totally overshadowed by the bad attitudes. We asked for a table to be cleaned so we could sit in a chair with a back and since the waiter didn't feel like cleaning it, he said we could wait for 20 minutes until he got around to it even though the restaurant was almost empty. When asking to speak to Manager, they just left us standing for 15 minutes and no one ever came out. There is a lack of gratitude for their customers business' that is remarkable. I would never even consider going back to a place that treats you like they are doing you some favor to serve you and take your money.

This place is a drunken brawl short of a donnybrook on any given night, make a reservation. Cherish the moments in which you get service, because they are short on staff. Here's a mnemonic device to help you remember, at Chada service is nada. Short, kitschy and easily digestible, unlike their dehydrate fish chunks.

There are books near the entrance, but that is a ruse, because the sub-literate narcissists who haunt this establishment are for want of all that is cerebral, and choose to be mind-numbingly facile in their enjoyment of life and its pulchritude. Translation, the scourge of humanity dines here: yuppies, vulture capitalists, Daddy Warbucks' parasitic Hilton-esque daughters, foodies and just about anything who would make Peter Singer, were he dead, rollover in his grave.

The wine list is impressive, the curry is spicy (as it should be), and the prices are perfect for those trying to get rid of their Weimar dollars before they have too much to wipe their buttocks with come the next meltdown. I'm only kidding there.

Enjoy!

We ordered seven dishes to share and LOVED them all. I will definitely be going back for more. We were a little disappointed that the mango sticky rice wasn't available, though. I'll have to come back when it's in season.

It's definitely hidden gem restaurant. We had team dinner there & we all love this restaurant. Great customer service, variety wine selections and delicious food. The food here is much better than the other popular Thai restaurant but save a lot waiting time. Will be back soon :)

I come all way from Aliante to eat w my family and i got so disappointed I been here before and I like this place but this time the people at front tell me is not tables because the have big party and I was like I wait or we eat fast I just don't care ..  just said no we can so next time put something on your door saying no tables and make the people wait

I love this place!  It's a diamond in the rough.    Everything I've ever ordered is good!  The prices and the wine are reasonable.  I come here at least 2 times a week with friends and always suggest it to everyone!

My favs to eat are

Beef jerky 
Raw oysters
Drunken noodle
Pad se eww
The glass noodles with seafood...forget what it's called

And good red wine ...turley

Sometimes service is a little slow but the food is always delicious!

Byebye Archie's, Pin Kaow, and all other Thai food places in Vegas (imho also Lotus and Komol). Clean, friendly, great (and very reasonably priced) vino selection, DELICIOUS food!  Really special dishes where thought was put into each dish with nice balance of flavors.  I don't understand why reviewers say the portions are small. I think for the price and quality, it's quite reasonable. This is the normal amount of food people should be eating anyway. It is a little tacky that rice is not included with curry though. Even though it's a trek to Chinatown, this is where we go when craving Thai. I'm excited to see how Chef Bank's new place, Chada Street, turns out. 

One mini note - I despise the shopping center it's in, it is so hard to find parking on a weekend night, so we try to go earlier for an early dinner or during a weeknight.  It's not a huge space, so if going w a large group, I'd def call ahead to make reservations.

Chada makes me regret every mediocre Thai takeout meal I've ever had, and I've had more of those than I care to admit. You think you've had "pretty good" Thai before? No, no, no you haven't. This is almost certain to blow everything else away.

After 3 visits in 2 months with groups, this is one of those places where just about everything is excellent. It's fine to go alone or for 2, but IMHO it's pretty ideal if you want to eat family style, and that way of course you get to sample more of the delicious food. The duck panang and Moo Khum Waan are favorites of mine, but if you're not that familiar with Thai food beyond pad Thai, don't be afraid to branch out. The staff is super helpful about answering questions and adjusting spice level preferences.

It's an insanely good value considering how excellent the food, service and ambiance are. I've been to Lotus and like it there too, but I'd have to say Chada is even better. And it's also in a nicer area plus easier to get a table (at least during the week), but it's getting more popular so call to reserve just in case.

Chada takes Thai cuisine to a new fresh and innovative level. Each and every bite is filled with a burst of flavors.  Must try the lettuce wraps, crispy duck and salmon panang.  Great food and great prices.
Terrific haw-nay! Not just your typical dishes at this place. Highly recommend eating outside of your typical Thai food comfort zone. You won't regret it. Be adventurous. They are.

Came here a couple of weeks ago. This place had a trendy atmosphere (gray walls, red chandelier) and the service was quick. Also, I heard that the owner was the prior sommelier for Lotus of Siam and thus promises good wine pairings in the future once he obtains his liquor license. For the time being I appreciate that they allow you to bring your wine with no corkage. 

The down side of this place was that the portion size for the price was rather small. I believe another person on Yelp stated japanese tapas size and I tend to agree.  The food was good, however, we ordered soup, appetizers and entree and they brought it out all at the same time.  However, that being said when we told the waiter they offered to have the entree dish re-fired.  

We had the oysters, an appetizer (I can't remember the name) that was similar to chicken lettuce wraps, the braised pork belly and Thom Ka Kai.  For three of us we spent $60 for dinner, with no drinks. We left full, not stuffed, but okay. 

Overall the food and atmosphere were good but for the price and quality I would rather go to Lotus of Siam.

The best thing of chada they are open late and the food is delicious.  There's a lot of places that are open after 12am and are not good at all. There duck fried rice, crab noodles, spicy coconut shrimp.  Pork belly. There whole fish.  I try to try something new every time I go. I love the look of the dining room it reminds me of San Francisco little hidden gems.

This place is amazing. Unique dishes and flavors make it my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. The oysters are ridiculously good as an appetizer. The curries are delicious - I like the crab one and also the beef panang is really tender. I also recommend the whole fish options. But you can also just ask you waiter to bring out whatever they recommend and you cant go wrong. Great decor and wine selection to boot.  Will go every time I'm in town!!

Don't let the non-descript location in a Chinatown shopping center deter you from going to Chada Thai.  The food is very authentic, with "real" Thai flavors not Americanized Thai.  

We especially  enjoyed the pork larb and lettuce wrap appetizers and the soft shell crab with tamarind sauce.  Also, the Kana Moo Krob (pork belly with Chinese broccoli) is not to be missed.  The Pad See Eiw though was ordinary.

We found the dishes were nicely spiced at the "two pepper" level, but maybe a bit mild at "one pepper".  We have visited Chada Thai and Wine twice on visits to Las Vegas and it is a great option for off the strip Thai food.

I've been here a few times and the food never disappoints. Everything is bursting with flavor and price is reasonable and portions are just right ... At least for me anyway ;)

Pad See Ew - 10/10
Pad Hed - 10/10
Panting Curry Slow Cooked Beef - f*ing fantastic 10/10
Pad Thai - 9/10
Moo Hong - pork belly, I don't eat this but friend really liked it

Excellent!  My friends and I enjoy trying new restaurants every time we come to Vegas. Upon cross referencing some "Best Of" lists Chada Thai & Wine kept popping up. This is a tiny strip mall restaurant in Chinatown...definitely call for reservations because seating is limited. The food was excellent...a real explosion of flavors in every dish. Service was great too...our waiter was very attentive and made some great recommendations.  He explained every dish in detail and knew when to warn us of things that were too spicy.  Definitely try the Miang Pou lettuce wrap (spicy crab) and the spicy herb spring rolls for an appetizer. Presentation was nice on both, and good portions too. For entrees we shared the crispy Duck Panang, Sea bass Tod Krueng, and Moo Khum Waan pork w/ Chinese broccoli. All were terrific, but the duck was the best, hands down..best I've ever had. 
If you're looking for a great dining experience off the strip, definitely give Chada Thai & Wine consideration. Food is excellent, with the detail and presentation of a much more expensive casino restaurant. There's not a dish over $20. This place is small; the picture on their website shows the entire dining room.  Don't shy away at first sight, the decor inside is very nice.   My only negative comment is that we were asked to move to another table mid-meal in order to accommodate a large group, but we were happy to do so because the food and staff was so incredible.

I'm a Thai food connoisseur and have had my share of fine Thai and was still pleasantly  surprised at this place. 
The location is misleading from the outside but the inside is lovely.
LOVE this place!! It is my boyfriend and my favorite date night spot. Amazing food and wine/bubble selection. Can never go wrong with coconut soup and papaya salad

What I enjoy from Chada, attentive service, the wine selection.  I appreciate that menu is an interesting, slightly modern take on Thai food.  They also keep their recipes fairly simple.  I've enjoyed most dishes from Chada, clean, clear, good combination of flavors.  Not much to complain for the price, minus chicken wings appetizer being overcooked and with too much sauce for my taste once, everything else is well executed .  I love the simplicity of their desserts, like the sticky rice with mango but I wish they also offered something more elaborated.  Chada has become one of my to go places in the area, in the same mall as another favorite China Mama.  I would definitively recommend to give it a try.

The best and must try!!

We were recommended this place by Gamini, our bell boy from Four Seasons Hotel. We are so glad we came here. It's a small restaurant but the food is to die for. Our 13 year old son loves the duck in Panang sauce, our 10 year old daughter can still taste the Tofu soup. Everything else that we ordered was also delicious - the shrimp starter, choo-chee prawn curry and everything else was outstanding!!

Not sure about the other reviews but this place is outstanding.  Having visited six times since it opened, I have found the food and service to always be great.  Each item has always been cooked to the perfect temperature and the prices are incredible for the quality.  The service is excellent, I am unsure why every restaurant does not take the time to train the staff like Chada obviously has.  Add in riedel stemware, a convenient location, nice buildout and a great playlist.....go.

Bon Apetit and Food & wine are right, this place is fantastic. Incredible brother duo of chef and sommelier create wonderful Thai and wine combos. I highly recommend the drunken noodles and duck entree and sautéed mushroom appetizer. It's off the beaten path but worth the trip.

Hands down the best Thai I ever had...we split a ton of dishes that were all excellent but the crispy beef is the one I can't forget about...it's calling me back and it will be soon.

We washed it down with a stellar Riesling and still managed to walk out for under $50 a couple. Outstanding!
This is my go to place whenever I'm craving for Thai food or just something spicy.  Every item I've had so far has been great! Service is always fast and friendly.

Definitely better than Lotus of Siam. Chada Thai is for those with more discriminating palate: every dish is more nuanced and complex.  The lettuce wrap appetizer with crab meat is my absolute favorite! I take all my friends from out of town to Chada Thai after taking them to Lotus.
Super cool inside. Decor is fun and hip. The food is outstanding!!  From the outside you would never expect this place to look as good inside when you see it from the st.  A must go!

Legit, Thai food.  I had the tom kah and the larb ground pork.  Both tasted good, with a good size portion, and a good price.  

My only complaint is that they are under staffed so I deducted 1 star, otherwise everything was great!!

We had a great experience here.   Food was fresh with a little different twist then many Thai restaurants.   After waiting for a taxi for 30 minutes one of the owners gave us a ride back to our hotel.   GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Great food and great service! The only downfall is that their menu isn't huge, but with the quality of the food it really doesn't matter. I get a curry every time (the Masaman is my favorite!) but everything is great. They also have a great selection of wine and they are vegetarian friendly.

Beautifully decorated, cozy ambiance.

Good wine list. Everything was fresh and flavorful.  Well rounded flavors.

Salmon Drunken Noodles were divine, as was a fried duck dish, a fried mushroom appetizer and the beef jerky.

Only reason I gave them 4 stars was because I felt the service needs to be more attentive.

Absolutely will recommend and be back frequently!

Came for a birthday party.  Food was excellent.  Tom Yum soup, beef jerky, oysters and papaya salad rocked.  Everything was clean and wonderfully spiced.  Very good wine list. Killed it with a Vouvrey.  The lemongrass salmon. Is highly recommended.  Thai soul food.  Will be back.  Very good service.
Everything was spot on. Great wine, great food, great service. Had an excellent Frappato followed with the Pad Hed, Yum Nua, & the Pad See Eiw. All amazing, we will definitely be back.
This is an amazing Thai restaurant with flavors I have never experienced, plus a wine list for every palate - my wife and I will come back the next time we are in Vegas

Amazing little place just off the strip, was going to go to our regular Lotus of Siam but thought we would try something new. Duck Penang is simply perfect and so was the Crab curry. My palate is happy and so is the soul!!!! Highly recommend this little gem in Vegas!!

Folks have been singing the praises of Chada Thai & Wine for two years strong, it seems to be quite the hit with Chefs and gourmands alike. I was happy when friends suggested we meet there for dinner. Pulling into the strip mall, you wouldn't expect anything special beyond Chada's door, but you're in for quite a surprise. The decor is sexy with dark woods, crimson accents, dim lighting and a wall of wines. The list of Rieslings go on for days, "Chada Thai & Riesling" could very well be appropriate. You'd expected nothing less from Bank Atcharawan at the helm, who gained fame as former sommelier at Lotus of Siam. 

Don't sweat it if you're not a fan of Riesling, there are whites, reds, beers, and sake to choose from. The menu specializes in Southern Thai cuisine, with a focus on seafood. It's a little overwhelming at first, but our group settled on Pad Hed, mushrooms with brussels sprouts ($8), Spicy Herb Fresh Roll ($8), Por Pia Tod, vegetable egg roll ($6), Pou Nim Ma Karm, crispy soft shell crab with tamarind ($19), Shrimp Pad See Eiw ($10), Chicken Pad Kee Mao ($8), and Chicken Pad Thai ($8). 

We thought we'd try a mix of unique dishes and standard Thai fare. The seafood dishes were better than those with chicken. The brussels sprouts were a bit soggy - I like crunch! and I anticipated bold flavor, but it didn't deliver. The fresh roll, on the other hand was bursting with zing from the ginger. The shame of it, was that it was so potent it overshadowed the other ingredients. The vegetable roll was crispy and on point. Overall, I was disenchanted with our choices. The sum of the parts didn't tally up to a memorable meal. Perhaps, I should have been more adventurous or maybe we caught them on an off night. Service was quite sluggish too. When competition is as fierce as it is in Chinatown it's hard to forgive these shortcomings.

Like others have mentioned- this is a bit of a spin-off of Lotus of Siam. The owner/ proprietor, Bangk, was the mastermind behind that now-venerable institution's amazing Riesling list, a perfect complement to the bold and complex flavors of Thai cuisine....

On to Chada- the space is not just updated, but far more refined than Lotus. It's not by any stretch capacious, but it is comfortable. That being said, the reason this place doesn't get five stars from me is strictly due to the lack of a bar/ counter space.

The food is easily on-par, if not above, it's protege's. If you love the food at Lotus, you're going to love the food at Chada, possibly even more. Service is more attentive,and the atmosphere is updated and comfortable- no lunch buffet steam-tables or faux-patio lattice work indoors.

Bangk has a passion that translates to guest experience- the alchemical golden equation of the restaurant business and experience. If you feel Lotus has lost it's soul (and I'm NOT with you there), this is the place you might find the part of you was longing for....

I actually got sick from eating a raw oyster here once, yet I still give this place 5 stars! Truly amazing Thai food. The first time I came here it was with a large group so we tried nearly everything on the menu. Everything was spectacular. I came here again with some friends. I got the eggplant and shrimp with chile-lime dressing. I thought it would be more like a stir-fry dish but they were neat little bites an not a heavy sauce. It was really yummy but a little more on the appetizer side than entree. My friend had the green curry and it was a perfect balance of flavor and spice and not overpowering coconut milk like usual. We also had the mushrooms and brussle sprout appetizers. In a random strip mall but inside is swanky and dim lighting. Everything was so delicious I can't wait to go back again.

This place is awesome! In fact the check for the place is sitting in frobt of me right now as I write this review; I couldn't even wait to get home. To begin with, the atmosphere is incredible. The colors and lighting are soft, warm, and romantic. The food is equally excellent. I ordered a green curry and it was the best I've had. Also, our wine, which our waiter helped us choose, was unbelievable. The service was perfect. Bon, our waiter was friendly and helpful without being overly intrusive. He seemed to genuinely care about making this the the best experience possible. I will come back.

Hands down the best meal I have had out in a while.  Service was fantastic and each dish was fresh and full of flavor.  
I split two appetizers and an entree with a friend.  We were trying to keep it light since we had another stop to make, but all that and a glass of wine was more than filling and very reasonably priced.  I am already planning my return visit to explore more of the menu.

Fresh oysters were excellent, an Asian take on oyster shooters in the half shell.
Spring rolls were excellent, refreshing. 
Duck Panang...wow great curry, duck perfectly cooked.
Crispy pork belly also a great option. 
Service was friendly and good speed.
One of my 3 favorite restaurants in Vegas for sure. Beef salad and pad see ew are an absolute must. PHENOMENAL date spot
By far my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Outdoes lotus of siam, which used to be my favorite in every aspect. The food here is unbelievable, try the chu chee crispy prawn and the fresh oysters!

We decided to drop in because it was really late and I'm so glad that we did. The food was amazing, the service was fantastic and did I mention the food was amazing! The shrimp is out of this world! To think an accidental walk in turned out to be one of the best Thai food places in town!

"All I can say is Lotus of Siam watch out! Absolutely my favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas! The home made curry with crab is simply outstanding. Great atmosphere (in a dump of a strip mall) excellent service, and a wine selection to rival any others.
Excellent service! Chada did not disappoint and I will definitely go back to try some new items.

Chada Thai highly impressive! Being a Thai girl myself, I was very pleased with the food and ambiance. The service was stellar as well. the decor in very chic, and not what you would expect door being in a strip mall in Chinatown. It's open until 3am, and since I am in the industry it was nice to have this option of going to a place and not feeling like we needed t rush to get there. My coworkers and I really enjoyed trying all the tapa style Thai dishes. Some were small plates, while others were normal portions and more than enough to share. I was excited trying different items that aren't usually seen on more traditional Thai menus. I would say some of the dishes were Thai Avante-Garde even! A must to try are the quail eggs! Yummy!
The oysters on the half shell( us girls even ordered a second order they were so food!), the soft shell crab with tamarind sauce was refreshing.
Don't forget to try the crispy pork belly and papaya salad with fresh grilled shrimp.
The only dish we didnt like was some pork patty thing.

They also have a very impressive wine selection. There are many more dishes we wanted to try to we will be going back for sure! Service was great as well!!
I absolutely loved this place!  Every dish we had was good.  One of my favorite Thai places to eat.

Fantastic, a real great find by chance. Other places where closed and just happened to spot this one. I love the simple funky decor. The food was outstanding. The service was outstanding. Pretty nice wine list. I love it.

It truly is a heavenly experience to find delicious food in Las Vegas away from the strip.  We found this restaurant on a random website and it is wonderful!!  We brought a bottle of wine to cork, but I my husband was so thrilled with the wine list that we bought one of theirs.  So many different flavors and tastes.  Amazing service with a very knowledgeable staff.   I would go back again and again!  Take a few friends with you so you can order more dishes to share!  

LOVED IT!

Dwayne our server is very knowledgeable and friendly. He recommended some great items that we tried and loved. Duck Panang is a given; you must order this. So far, everything is fantastic from the service to the food.

I am in love with this place!  It is cute and intimate place with about 15 tables.  They have a nice wine wall at the back of the restaurant.  We ordered the chicken pad thai and the beef fried rice, both delicious.  The thai ice teas were a bit on the sweet side but you will have to let the ice melt a bit to dilute the sweetness.  But overall this is definitely a cute place and I can see myself making this place a regular.

This is my new favorite Thai spot in town. It's small, quaint, and most of all the food is amazing. The fresh herb spring rolls are everything I have ever wanted out of a spring roll that I never seem to get. The drunken noodles are a must! Service here is great, the whole ambiance is fun. I have yet to have a dish on the menu I didn't absolutely love.

We will come back. So many good things and no wait. Stand outs: Pangang Curry so so so good, shrimp satay, mangos and sticky rice. We also ordered the Miami Pou, it was good, sea bass Tod Krueger was not one I would order again. Over all we loved it and will come back.
First timer and the food was okay. Fried catfish's serving was surprisingly small and way too spicy for mild. The crab fried rice was good also the chicken satay. Overall it was okay.

My good friend has introduced me to a number of Thai places in the city and I've been impressed with a few including Weera and Pinkaow.  Chada ranks up there with the others.  

It's locate in a strip mall in an unassuming area.  However, you'll be surprised upon entering.  It's modern, trendy, and well decorated on the inside.  It perhaps has the best atmosphere of any asian restaurant I've been to on Spring Mountain.  The decor and ambiance are right down my alley.

The food itself was very good.  Although you may have to order a number of dishes to get full (as the portion sizes are small).  Overall, the dishes were good.  Some shined more than the others.  For example, I loved the ribeye salad and grilled pork dishes.  Both tasted fresh, light, and were delicious.  On the other hand, their crab curry was decent, but light in flavor.  Their drunken noodles was decent as well.

All in all, Chada still deserves recognition from it's service, atmosphere, decor, and most food items.

I recently visited this place after reading about it in Eater issue. It is cute and small, good for small groups and a casual bite. The food was decent and service was fine overall. We brought our own bottle of wine, there is no corkage fee, which we liked. The portions are rather small, but the prices are not high either. We had lettuce wraps with crab meat for appetizer, pork belly and yellow curry as a main dish. I did not care for dessert - coconut jelly. I will go back again.

Bottom line: the food here is excellent. Everything had fantastic flavor and was cooked to perfection. We had:

Green papaya salad (awesome)
The braised pork belly (juicy, fatty richness)
Pad thai with omelette on top (really good, although the people sitting next to us also ordered it and their portion was significantly larger)
Crispy duck panang curry (good, although Lotus' is better... Tip: ask for the sauce on the side! They give you more and you can pour it over rice)
Sautéed pork with raw garlic and Chinese broccoli (waiter recommendation that was on point!)
Grilled prawns and eggplant (Would not be anything to write home about except for the cilantro dipping sauce which our group started eating by itself over rice it was so good!)

The main drawbacks are the small portion size, which is not ideal for larger parties, and the service is a bit slow (although there was a gigantic party eating at the same time as us, so that may have had something to do with it.) Make reservations for sure, as the space is rather small. But definitely go!!

Chada Thai & Wine is a quaint authentic Thai restaurant with an extensive wine list. The food was outstanding. The Chuchee Prawns were delicious. I'm a fan of Lotus of Siam and this place is on par with better decor and service. I do prefer the crispy duck panang from Lotus of Siam. With that said, their Tom Yum is one of the best I've ever had. I highly recommend it. Be sure to make reservations as it is a smaller establishment that fills up quick!

Chada is definitely top 3 Thai restaurants in Vegas. I came here after hearing all the hype about it and will say it lives up to its reputation. The food is great and a little bit less of a wait than Lotus of Siam. I ordered the crispy duck curry dish and the garlic prawns which were really good. The service is great and the staff was friendly. Would have to say it is 2nd to Lotus though...

My husband and I shared the spicy duck rice and drunken noodles with beef.  The rice was alright but nothing special.  The drunken noodles on the other hand were delicious.  I have had much better Thai other wise I would have given it more stars.
Tom yum soup & drunken noodles were good. Avoid mango sticky rice, beef salad, and chicken curry. Clean restaurant with good customer service. Won't come back.
Very good place. Crispy curry duck, Tom kha khai and mango and sticky rice all splendid. Surprisingly attractive in an ugly strip mall.

Crispy duck: A+
Fish in broth with bokchoy and mushrooms: A +
Wine list: limited.

Funky space.
Unexpectedly good Thai food.

(That food isn't my favorite and never my first choice, but the service, quality of food items, and plate presentation make Chada a special gem.)
One of the better Thai places in town to eat. Will. E coming back here again for sure

I tried this place cause a friend said it was good. But I tried it and it tasted like dog food. This place doesn't deserve to serve people food in Vegas . They need to take this cheap over priced place back to South Korea!
No need to go to a Lotus of Siam now. Chada doesn't have a wait and it's better! This is one of my favorite restaurants now. Everything was great and with a glass of wine it's amazing!
We had dinner here with some friends while in Las Vegas.  Service was excellent.  There is an extensive wine list available as well.  Food was very good with the correct spice level.

Probably my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  Great food - I can't say enough about it- and a fantastic wine list all reasonably priced.  Seriously two people can have dinner here for less than 2 or 3 drinks on the Strip and yet the food and wine are better than anything to be found on the Strip.  Seriously, it is that good.
Love the authentic taste of this Thai Restaurant!! Everything was on point, I would definitely go again. Despite that the service in that particular late night was kinda slow

Chada is our Go To restaurant whenever we have friends visiting!!

The ambient is dark in a trendy way, not a bougouis way! and the wait staff is always helpful and friendly

Our absolute favorite is the Raw oysters which has this garlic chili dressing and the charbroiled prawns which has an amazing cilantro lime spicy dressing!! The lemon grass spring rolls and duck fried rice.. Honestly there's no bad item on the menu!

Definitely make a reservation if planning to go on the weekends!

New place opened in the same plaza as Q Karaoke, Icy Juicy, and HK Star. Apparently it is opened by the Sommelier from Lotus of Siam. 

We went kind of late (10:30PM on a Thursday evening). There were two other groups there. The restaurant was designed nicely with a nice atmosphere. Left wall is designed with framed wine labels. Far end of the restaurant (coming into restaurant) is the wine rack. 

The restaurant was designed contemporary style with white dinnerware (square plates, "oddly" shaped bowls, etc) 

We were seated and served with water. The water was in a container with no ice. Not sure how to describe the container but its something you sometimes see in a korean place for the flavored soju. It has like a plastic "cork" like cap and a metal thing that u pull away and lift up to take off the cap. XD 

We had ordered 3 things. 

- Miang Pou (Lettuce wrap w/ crab meat, ginger, roasted coconut, peanuts, lime, and onion) 
- Tom Kah Kai (Coconut soup with mushroom - chicken)
- Kai Tod (Fried half cornish hen w/ garlic) 

with a bowl of rice on the side ($1 extra - not included)

Starting off with the Miang Pou (lettuce wrap). (refer to picture for presentation and reference). The wraps (5) were oriented around the plate like a star with a shot glass in the middle filled with the sauce. Each "portion" had a little of each ingredient on a baby leaf of romaine-like lettuce. A note that was not listed in the ingredient list above, each portion has a small thai chili piece in it (if u cant eat spicy, dont eat it). The sauce that was included was a little too? citrusy/sour, (probably from the lime), and probably contained a sauce made with peanuts, lime, and onions. For some odd reason, there was something bitter in the wrap, but i couldn't pinpoint what it may have been. 

Next would the the Tom Kah Kai. It was served in a large bowl. Not like some other thai restaurants, where it is served on a sterno heated pot. This soup, was also a little citrusy/sour. It was flavorful but both me and my friend would prefer it to be more rich (more coconut milk) vs the sourness. Decent amount of ingredients. Still delicious when eating alone or with rice !

Last but not least, the Kai Tod. This was actually the most delicious dish out of the 3. It was nicely fried. The breading was light and crispy. Not thick. The meat of the hen was juicy and flavorful. As i was eating the piece of hen, i noticed how the seasoning was actually inserted in between the meats and around. Maybe a little heavy on the black pepper but it was still good. (i like black pepper anyway) . There was approx 6-7 decent sized pieces. Wish they put more fried garlic (i love garlic !) 

Overall it was an ok experience. The lettuce wrap kind of seemed a little expensive for how much you get. Was a little saddened by how the soup was like. 
Wished the menu was a little bigger but the food wasn't bad. Service was decent. Price was ok. Little more expensive than the average thai restaurant.
Our family's new Thai restaurant. Duck panang and crab fried rice are our favorites. Service is great, food is excellent. We've been back twice in a week.

Love this place.

Food was not the best I have ever had at a Thai place, BUT, this place is cute - with great lighting. Huge wine selection. AND very good, friendly staff.

Busy parking lot.

Oh, food was a little bland for Thai.

Would I go back - YES!
Their penang duck was amazeballs. That crab curry was grand also. Love the ambience and service.

This restaurant was recommended to us by a local couple we met at the hotel. The menu has a few favorites you'd find at any Thai restaurant but is full of other more unique entrees I've never seen on a Thai restaurant menu (and trust me I've been to a lot). We ordered the Duck Panang, which was flavorful but the portion was tiny (6 pieces for $20), pad see eiw noodles with chicken (nothing special here), pad kra pow with ribeye steak (delicious!), and spicy herbs spring roll (very good). All in all, the food was pretty good but the prices are high and the portions are small.

Oh Chada what has happened to you? As regulars we dine there several times a month. The past 4-5 months the service has noticeably dropped in quality. The wait staff seems completely incompetent.  Perhaps some blame could be shared in the back but there is no excuse for the drop in quality of service and to a lesser extent the food.

Last night we ordered soup for the table. After about 15 minutes the waitress came over and asked if we wanted to order the mains. We said sure. They then brought out bowls for the soup but no soup. Waiting another 15 minutes we flagged down the server and inquired about the soup. She said it was coming. 

The soup appears and we take our first bites when (you guessed it) our mains came out. When I pointed out that we had just gotten the soup she had a deer in the headlights look and tried to pull the entrees off of the table. We told her to leave it. After eating the soup and the mains the same server comes out with the appetizer salad that had been ordered and hour earlier and evidently forgotten.

The food is still pretty good but not anything close to their former highs. The drunken noodles tasted fine but were all stuck together. More like a noodle "cake".
Great place to go after work. The food is fast and reasonably priced. They also have a great house plum wine!

My search for great Pad Thai is never ending. I mean until I go to Thailand I probably won't find amazing Pad Thai - although I could probably come pretty close. But, Jessica how do you know what amazing Pad Thai tastes like if you've never been to Thailand? Good question, I don't. LEAVE ME ALONE! 

Anyhow, I got take out tonight and it was still nommmy. I'm sure if I ate in the restaurant it would be much better. So, I ordered the Duck Panang, Pad Thai, and some Soft Shell Crab thing. The Duck Panang and Pad Thai were muy muy delicioso! I could probably eat this all the time if it weren't so expensive. I don't even like duck, but I got it because a friend recommended it. The duck is crispy and the curry is spicy! The Pad Thai is worth getting if you're looking for a side o' noods. Next time I'll probably try the Pad Kee Mao.

Amazing food, I still can't stop talking about this place to friends. My husband and I stumbled upon this gem while searching for a place to eat. We ordered the spicy herbs spring roll as an appetizer, which made us instantly want to order more of them. They have just the right amount of veggies and meat. The wrapping was not hard or chewy which is a problem we usually run into. I ordered the tofu soup as my entree and it was reminded me of growing up and eating soup that my parents made me when I wasn't feeling well. Very simple with so much flavor. My husband ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and it was just spot on. Best Thai food in Las Vegas.

Love the atmosphere and the service is always great, everyone is friendly. 
Food is terrific, try the Massamun curry or the Thai iced tea.
Prices are around the same as most Thai places.

We went for Thai food after a recommendation from a server from a restaurant on the strip.  We didn't have reservations but, we were seated right away.  There was only another couple there at the time we arrived (around 5:30 ish).  The restaurant is very small. People eat late in Vegas so maybe that's why we got a table. We ordered the Spicy Herb a Spring a Rolls as an appie.  Light and refreshing.  What stood out for flavours were the basil and mint which was not over powering.  Then we had Prawn Pad Thai.  This had a fried egg on top rather than scrambled fried with the noodles. Taste was good.  Noodles were not mushy. Green Curry (they let us sub chicken).  Taste was good and the seasonings were balanced. The Crsipy Duck Panang Curry.  That was the star of the dinner for my fiancé. The sauce was not thin. Nice and creamy.  Had great flavour. Although the sauce was on top of the duck, the skin stayed nice and crispy throughout the meal.  Thought I was too full, but managed to squeeze in the Mango sticky rice. That was such a treat. The mangoes were perfectly ripened.  Sweet, juicy and fragrant. The sticky rice was delicious too. We had great service and we will definite be back when we return to Vegas. From the strip it's about a 10 minute drive.

This is the best Thai food I've ever tried.  I have never had steak curry that simply melts in your mouth. We also had spring rolls and crispy duck.  OMG - this place is so good.  We went to Lotus of Siam the next night and both agreed that Chada was better.  Amazing and good food.  And for bonus they are open until 9:00 p.m.  When you are in Vegas, do yourself a favor and run, don't walk, to this place.  This is a MUST try.

Amazing. The food is unreal. I have a gluten allergy that can make things difficult. The waiter knew right away what to show me that was GL. the curry was unreal. The wine list was excellent. There were so many bottles to choose from and the prices were great. The is a hidden gem away from the strip.
Best wine selection in Thai restaurant and yes, I have been to Lotus of Siam. I love the food and the service here! Keep it up!

If you appreciate kindness and respect for others please DO NOT dine here.  I would give no stars if I could. Very dissapointed in the service.  I have eaten at this restaurant many times and do not think I will be coming back nor will I recommend this restaurant to anyone. Las Vegas has many great places to eat so this restuarant should consider service a priority if it wants to remain in business.  The staff is rude, inconsiderate, slow and believes that because their food is good the service does not need to be.  I rarely take the time to write reviews but when I do its because others need to know important-good or bad things about the places they choose to spend their money at.

Very disappointing.  I ordered Rib Eye Stir Fry and it was served with no vegetables or rice. The meal consisted of gristly meat in a greasy sauce with jalapeno peppers and basil.  The peppers  obscured whatever flavor the sauce might have had.  The waiter got my husband's order wrong so our meals were served at different times.  With so many other Asian restaurants in the area, I would not recommend going here.
Excellent food and service. If you're bold enough to let your server guide you, you won't go wrong. Everything is great.

OMG. So. So. So good. Highly recommend this place. It was spectacular.

I'm a huge fan of Thai food, and luckily my boyfriend's colleague is an even better fan and dragged us out of our laziness to take a Lyft out to this place. From the first bite of the papaya salad (spicy, fresh, tangy, fish-saucey) I knew we were in for a treat. 

I split the pork belly and the Pad Kee Mao with steak with my boyfriend and we gobbled up every last bite. We also tasted the panang curry and it was sublime. Definitely wouldn't mind having more here!
Ordered food for pick-up. Was okay. The Pad See Ew at Chada Street was 500x better.
Fabulous. A friend took me here last night. Wonderful food, we had panang curry, duck fried rice and Chilean sea bass.  What a wonderful combination of flavors.

Very fresh ingredients and great overall food and service experience. We had the spring rolls (wrapped in lettuce) which were excellent. Main dishes were amazing as well. We defiantly will be back for great thai food.

I find myself craving this place daily. I actually have to refrain from going here too often so I don't wear it out. I was first introduced by a friend. He ordered about 8 different things on the menu so I could try it all. There wasn't one thing that was not delicious. I've made the beef pad see ew my go to meal. The place is smaller so I'd recommend making a reservation an hour or so before.

Great foods and excellent services. We enjoy all the dishes we ordered from Spicy crab curry, garlic prawns , beef salad and duck fire rice. Oh and don't forget the wine selection also pretty good as well.

Chada is probably my favorite Thai spot in Vegas.   We never felt like drinking here but I know they have amazing selection of wines.   Do not order the drunken noodles here.   Probably the only dish I think they do below average Thai places.  It's very sweet and saggy and also on a bed of salad greens.   Just weird.  Their Curry is good especially the crab curry.  The seabass was cooked perfectly too.   We always come here on business dinners.  It's also one of the Most expensive Thai restaurant in Vegas as well.
Love love love! The sea bass is incredible, so is the grilled shrimp & eggplant. Their thai basil is a staple for take out. One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city.

OMG!  I am so glad Chada is here on the West Side of LV.  I am a huge Lotus fan, but Lotus is far and recently been variable.  While brings the same memory as the first time at Lotus, the food and vibe is completely different.  Casual, but demurely hip, if you KWIM.

With its clean lines and simple color palate of grey and red, Chada reminds me of simple modern start up restaurants in NYC...that is a nice look.  While not very big, the place seat about 40 people comfortably. 

As of this point, Chada does not have a liquor license so no alcohol served.  We did take advantage of their courtesy BYOB with no corkage fee!  However, I look forward to their wine selection in the future, though. 

The menu style is all small plates, but the portions are equivalent of atleast 1.5 main dish servings. I hope that doesn't change,  because the dish prices range are extremely affordable ranging from $6-18; most dishes averaging in $8-12.  Some of the fish and beef dishes are in the higher price ranges, but well worth it.

My husband got the spring rolls, which was $6 for 4 rolls...pretty reasonable.  We got 4 oysters in chili sauce and mint for $8, the crispy pork belly with sauteed greens (choy something) for $10?,  Seabass Tod Krueng was phenomenal...extremely tasty, unique generous portion even at $18, and sauteed ribeye in fish sauce.  While execution was still a bit "slow" it made for a nice relaxing meal while we sipped on our favorite wines.  Every dish was prepared beautifully.  I can't wait to come back and try all the other dishes too.

A few things.  You can tell the establishment is new, servers are still learning the menu, but they were polite. The menu lack organization, but that can be a good thing, because it makes you look through the entire menu. Once ordered, dishes came out one by one with a bit of lag time in between, but again, it really gave each dish time to be enjoyed.  I can't wait to go back; it better be soon, because I know Chada's popularity is going to skyrocket to the height it deserves.  Congrats to Chada and to us, Westsiders, who have something just as special as, if not better than, Lotus, closer to home.

I was taken to Chada by a friend while visiting Vegas. I'd lived in Vegas for a couple of years and was well acquainted with the Thai offerings: Lotus of Siam, Archies, and Krung among them. The meal I had at Chada surpassed them all. 

I won't go into extensive detail. Suffice to say that the fresh oysters, crab curry, and ribeye with mint sauce. All were exceptional. I was hoping to get back again before my trip ended. I can't recommend this highly enough.

This Thai restaurant is the most flavor-able I have ever had!! The flavors are mouth watering with every bite. The service was exceptional! Will definitely be going back. Prices are reasonable as well.

Chada Thai has been me and my husband's most favorite place in town for the last couple of months since we discovered this place. 

First, I love the atomospher of the restaurant. Good size, nice decorations and never be super crowded and loud so you can enjoy being there and having conversation with your family and friends. 

The quality of food is absolutely fantastic! My favorite is PAD KRA-POW, YUM WOON SEN SEAFOOD and home made beef jerky. They are all amazing and I can eat this everyday. However, you have to be a little careful about choosing how spicy you want. I usually get between 5 to 7 out of 10 at Thai restaurants and when we first went there, I ordered "medium". Oh my got the food was very very spicy! I had probably 10 glasses of water before finishing my food but it was still good. When I asked the waiter if it was really medium, he said it was and he can't even have medium because it is too spicy. 

They have nice selections of wine too. I hear the owner of the restaurant used to be a?sommelier at Lotus of Siam, another favorite restaurant of us in Downtown who also have so many kinds of wine. 

Unfortunatelly I have not tried their desserts yet because we always end up feeling like having shaved ice nearby (Kuma!!) on the way home. Lol
The best (contemporary) thai restaurant in town. Food and service are both very good while the wine list is outstanding. Very reasonably priced, too.
Amazing Thai food off of the Las Vegas Strip.  My girlfriend and I ordered a variety of dishes and they were all on point.  Reasonably priced and open late.  Enjoy.

Chada is one of my all time favorite Thai restaurants in Las Vegas because not only are they small and intimate but the best part is all their veggies are only seasonally grown and served. I would highly recommend  this place to anyone who is looking for Thai food.

I was really hoping Chada would be a good stand in for Lotus of Siam, but it's not. LOS is far and away a better spot.

I should have listened to my instinct that told me to run when I entered a restaurant full of white people in the middle of Chinatown. I stayed though because I trusted the Yelp reviews.

We were asked if we had reservations which we didn't, but we were seated anyways. The restaurant wasn't at all full. I understand that it's necessary to have empty tables sometimes so that the kitchen can keep up with the tickets and people won't be waiting too long. However, I found it puzzling that the host was turning away people when there were only four other occupied tables.

Chada has a good wine selection though not as voluminous as LOS. We were very happy with our riesling, and the pricing was good.

We got two starters, the vegetarian green papaya salad, and the beef jerky. My husband thought the jerky was weird, and he didn't even finish the salad which is saying something because he has a huge appetite.

We got red curry, his with duck and mine with tofu. I thought the tofu was prepared well, but the curry itself was no better than what I can get at my neighborhood place. My husband's duck tasted fine (not too chewy) but the skin wasn't crisp like the duck curry at LOS.

We were pretty disappointed with our dinner and will make sure to always secure a reservation at LOS for future vegas trips.

It was our first time here.We ordered spicy and sour soup with shrimp and mushrooms to share and pad Thai. 
It was literally the best Thai I have ever had. The server guy was so nice but the lady was kinda rude:) will come back...

This was almost 5 stars for me.  I'm vacationing in Las Vegas for my birthday.  Everywhere we have eaten on the strip has been overpriced and mediocre so we decided to eat somewhere that was not on the strip.  The food at this place was amazingly good and the prices were fair.  I got green curry with pork and I cannot explain to you how good it was.  The pork was moist and crispy at the same time, just perfection.  The sauce was yummy.  I ordered sticky rice to go with my curry and it was yummy too.  My husband got panang curry with hanger steak which was also good.  My best friend got some kind of lobster dish which was also good.  (We all taste each other's food). The restaurant has a long wine list, some wines on the list are quite expensive.  I got a glass of Syrah for $7, nothing expensive.  I feel overall that I loved the food at this place and I would to eat there all the time but I can't give this restaurant a full 5 stars because of these reasons:

1. When we got there our waitress told us all our portion sizes would be small and rice does not come with the dish and we have to buy the rice separately.  Usually rice does come with food so I wondered if the small portions and extra rice charge was just a cash grab thing.  It was kind of off putting.  However in the end I feel my portion size was fine and the price was fine overall as well.  It would be nice if rice were included though.

2. My wine was not chilled.  It was hot and I didn't like that.

3. My waitress questioned my tip and I felt that was a little rude.  My waitress was polite enough but she didn't do anything exceptional.  If I have a waiter or waitress that wows me I tip more.  I have tipped people a $20 before for being awesome.  I tipped this lady a $5.  My husband and I were eating with our best friends who are another married couple.  At first they brought us the check with all four orders combined.  We asked if it could be separated into two checks, one for each couple.  Instead she separated it into 4 checks.  So my husband told her, hey just pay these 2 checks with the same card then.  Then he wrote in one tip.  She also made us write a tip before she even ran our card because she said it had to be done that way due to the fact that the credit card has a chip in it.  Then she came back after she saw the $5 tip my husband wrote down and said, "this is it?  For both checks?"  That was beyond rude.  I suppose she thought if she made 4 checks she would get 4 tips.  She literally asked us about a tip about 5 times before she finally ran our card.

Based on those three things I can't give this place five stars.  If you go to this restaurant be ready to enjoy some good food.  But just know your wine will be hot and they will pressure you to tip them more than they deserve.

My girlfriend and I discovered this place late one night and it is one of our favorite spots in Vegas now! 

We try and get something new every time, which is kind of scary because the food from each previous visit is so good that we are afraid the new item isn't going to be as delicious...but nope. Everything on the menu is amazing!

The panang duck is incredible and if you want to save some money, you can get chicken or steak instead of duck and it's super cheap. Like $9!  

The Moo Hong (Black Pepper Pork Belly) is one of our favorites!

The larb is much better than Lotus of Siam, in my opinion.

The drunken noodles and pad Thai are excellent too!

Everything is really really good and the prices are shockingly cheap compared to other Thai restaurants we've been to.

Then there's the service. It was always good before, but after introducing myself to Chloe and Gap after the third visit, they've been even more friendly and amazing. Before, the service was 10/10, but now that I know the staff, I feel like family every time I walk in!  Service is STUPENDOUS now!  3,892/10!  Is that a realistic score?  Yes...yes it is.

We love this restaurant! Thai food has so many good flavors, small intimate ambience and nice wines. It is much nicer than a lot of other small Thai restaurants and food and service is awesome! Parking can be a little difficult at times but the food and service is worth it.

My husband was in Vegas for work for a few months and told me this place was even better than Lotus of Siam.  And, it was super tasty!!  And super accommodating for vegetarians. 
 We'll definitely be going back next time we're in Vegas.
Delicious food, beautiful ambiance & amazing service!  My new favorite Thai restaurant!  Amazing!
Excellent food and pleasant atmosphere and service!

First of all, I am a huge fan of Thai food and have visited Thailand several times. We come from Chicago to Vegas every year for a trades how and this is our first stop. It is my favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. I don't understand the excitement with Lotus of Siam. The quality of the food and flavors here are true and some the dishes are very innovative, you will be thinking about them for weeks on wards.  All the salads, nua nam tok, panang curry with salmon and pad kee mao.. the curries are all off the hook! Highly recommended..

This place lived up to my expectations. Very deserving of the praise that precedes them. It's a blink-and-you'll-miss-it spot in a busy Chinatown plaza, with great décor touches like a giant red chandelier and a wall-size wine rack. Start off with a glass of the Riesling or the Textbook Cab, $8 and $9 respectively. 

PAD HED: One of my favorite apps. Simple but great stir fry of Brussels sprouts and mushroom with lotus root chips, with a touch of oyster sauce. You'll want the whole portion for yourself. 
SOM THUM: Classic papaya salad with an excellent lime-tamarind dressing. Presentation was nice but the whole large wedges of cabbage were problematic as we were only provided spoons and forks. Splurge the $4 more to add shrimp. 
GREEN CURRY: So creamy! Love the crispy grilled pork. Lots of textures in here, rice is a separate side order for a buck or two. Very fresh and sophisticated.
SPICY DUCK RICE: Giant portion of rice but minimal duck (couldn't have been more than 2-3 ounces). Nice spicy, building heat to the dish. Again, nicely but inconveniently plated with large, thick slices of cucumber that we could barely cut into with our provided forks. Maybe that's supposed to discourage me from eating the garnish.

Beautiful setting definitely makes this a good date-night pick. Service was polite and professional on our most recent visit. I suggest reservations, as we had a poor experience trying to drop in one night. They were half empty but the host had an attitude about us walking in casually dressed. Turned me off enough to stay away for six months, but the food is great.

OMG!!!! I think I found my new favorite Thai place!!!!! :-)

The food was delicious!  Well balanced and well flavored.  I tried 3 different dishes and all three were perfect!  

If u are looking for a good...no GREAT Thai place, this is the place to come. 

I've tried Lotus of Siam and hands down Chada Thai is better.  I've tried Archi's and the food at Chada tastes more authentic! :-)

Service was awesome!  Totally all over you without being intrusive. :-)

And the wine selection.  Awesome!  I had the Riesling which paired perfectly with the spicy flavors. 

I can't wait to come back and try every single dish on their menu. But my absolute fav...Pad Hed. :-)

Consistently one of the better Thai restaurants I've dined in across many trips and many years in Vegas. Chada's dishes are a bit more "creative" and stand out in my favorites as so *@(@* good and I've never seen this prepared this way anywhere else! 

In fact, on my last trip to Vegas, I Lyfted from the strip to this location no less than 3 evenings for dinner.  Chada's attentive service staff have always been spot on as my water glass never ran dry.  My all time favorites dishes are:  
1) Nua Dad Diew an in-house beef jerky. If you like jerky, this is for you to try.   
2) Miang Pou - this dish is a star. It is served on carefully prepared lettuce  leaves, coconut, peanuts, crab, ... WOW.. I could have 2 of these and be in nirvana! 
3) Spicy Spring Roll - This is a good take on fresh spring rolls. I love the spicy components. 
4) Coconut and Sweet Rice - round out a meal

As for the wine selections at Chada, I am not a wine SME.  My preference are whites and mostly Eiswein or desert wines.  What I can report from this visit is what I heard from a table nearby. They were quite "impressed" with Chada's wine selections and by the end of the meal, they had finished 2 or 3 bottles.  

Before other posters rib me on, "... What about the other 3 or so other very good Thai restaurants in Vegas?"  Yes, I've eaten at most all of these and I shuffle between them.  Yes, you cannot go wrong at those or at Chada if you are in mood for Thai.  Reservations are always recommended, especially on weekends and it's an easy Lyft from the strip. Peace, Later.

Absolutely without a shadow of doubt the most incredible Thai food I have ever had. Hubby, bro and sis agreed. Appetizers we can vouch for: Pad Hed, Miang pou lettuce wraps and Nua nam tok. Felt bad for ordering Pad Thai because come on, you can get that everywhere and they have so many unique dishes, but I think I just found out what pad Thai is supposed to taste like. More savory, less sugary, little slice of lime. Oooo food coma comin on.
Not usually a fan of spicy food, but their Spicy Duck Fried Rice is BOMB. Too bad about the loud karaoke sounds you can hear through the walls. Ruins the atmosphere of the restaurant.

Innovative food, very clean tasting and fresh, and generous portions.

One of the best pad kee mao I've ever had, though my spice-sensitive partner might disagree. We ordered medium and it was SPICY but I loved it. Also nice tofu with it.

The mushroom/brussels sprouts dish was nice but kind of bland, and the same goes for the fried mushrooms, which really need a dipping sauce (comes with nothing).

Service friendly but pretty hands off. 

I would definitely come back for the nice Thai dishes that aren't found on too many menus as well as the traditional dishes. Really appreciated the less sweet and more authentic tastes.

Even more, I appreciated the lack of televisions! It was quiet and undistracting. We had come to District One originally but fled when we saw the sports-bar-like TVs everywhere. The calm and quiet Chada won our business.

Insider tip: TOTALLY FULL parking lot, even in the off-season. Maybe the back of the horrible strip mall has parking? We grabbed the last open spot.

Complaint: They give you styrofoam for your leftovers. It's as if all of Las Vegas is trying to drown the world in styrofoam. More restaurants should set better examples and be more green. I think they brought straws with water too.
Order everything thats mentioned on the Jimmy eats vegas blog.  It will blow your mind.  Incredible.  I love bringing people to this place.

This place has some seriously delicious Thai food. This is my second visit and I plan to come more often! First time I came here I got the duck panang and that is a must! If this is your first time visiting, trust all the reviews and give this dish a try!

My second visit we got: Pad see eiw with shrimp, Crab curry with thin rice noodles, and Shrimp satay.

Side note: The crab curry is on the spicy side. I would rate it as 6 on a scale of 1-10. 

Everything we got that night was mighty tasty and satisfied my craving for Thai food. 

Another side note: I would recommend making a reservation especially on the weekends as this place gets pretty busy.

Very clean and calm thai restaurant in sw town.
The best thing I love is they have lots of wines
foods are clean and tasty
But this restaurant is bit of small,so be sure to make a reservation before you go if you don't want to wait

Great Thai Food! We walked in at around 7:45pm and the place was empty but by 8:15pm the place was filling up. Service was great, friendly staff. Everything our group ordered was delicious. We started with the crab lettuce wraps. Had a nice kick to it and the sweetness of the coconut flakes was a tasty surprise. We had the Panang Duck, Pad Thai with Shrimp, Pork Pad Gra Prow (minced pork in basil and chili) and Chinese Broccoli with Pork Belly.  Enjoyed it all and decent portions for the price. I thought the prices were very fair. They have a pretty good wine list. This place can normally be very busy I'm told, so make reservations if you don't want to wait- it's not a big place. Fist Visit and I will definitely be back.

I really love this place and the staff!  Been coming here for almost a year... food quality never fails to deliver, love the cozy atmosphere and the staff are like friends now, they always make us feel welcome and appriciated!

Chada Thai & Wine is amazing. I generally encounter Thai food that is heavy, overly saucy, and lacking subtlety. The freshness and delicacy of Chada's food is amazing. Beneath the many layers of ingredients in their curries and sauces, you still taste the very freshest ingredients. 

Chada also has an incredible selection of white wines that perfectly complement Thai cuisine. With ample choices of Champagne, German and Austrian Riesling, you can choose the perfect match to almost any dish. 

This was the best Thai meal I have ever had, and that includes Lotus of Siam.

This place is just amazing! The food is delicious and authentic. I went with my boyfriend and the only thing that we can complain about is that the portion size could be bigger lol. We started off with the pad hed and the thai jerky. Both were on point! I would definitely try it if you haven't yet. He got the duck panang and I got the drunken noodle with crispy duck. Again, both on point. I would definitely order both again. The drunken noodle is topped with super crispy fried duck that you think might get soggy after sitting in the sauce of the noodles, but not at all. It's also topped with crispy fried basil which is another addition that I loved. The place was small and fairly busy when we went for the first time, but the service was great and we got our good pretty quickly. I will definitely be coming back for more delicious thai food.

This is my absolute favorite Thai place in LV! Better than Lotus of Siam, Krung, and Archie's, Nittanyas Kitchen. Everything was fresh, flavorful and a great modern spin on Thai, even though their classic Thai dishes are great too. Here everything actually has it's own taste, not like some Thai places where everything tastes the same. The prices are super reasonable for the quality of food. Service is great. Extensive wine list. And I love the fact they are open very late.

Damn good, Im going back to try again soon. If you guys could of had the food I had last night this place would have 5 out of 5 from all the yelpers out there .I hear this place might be a bit inconsistent but fuck I had a great time eating last night, no problems here.

This is a hidden gem in Vegas!  Awesome Thai food in a busy shopping center.  Great service and our wait staff was super helpful on giving us recommendation for our 1st time visit.  We really enjoyed the Chu Chee Crispy Prawn even though I'm not big on curry.  This dish had a good balance between the seafood and red curry.  Yum Woon Sen Seafood had a lot of seafood in this light glass noodle dish too!  Highly recommend the Shrimp Satay and Pad Kee Mao.  This is a must-try!

What a shame. The food is good. The menu (and wine, surprisingly) isn't as good as Lotus of Siam, but the food was fine. However, our group of four was told to please keep it down. Friday night, party of four...but the party of 10 behind us was fine..? When you've got six occupied tables, you might want to wait a minute before you quiet down your guests. Were we loud? Yup. But for two minutes. Relax. We liked our waiter. But we'll never go back. Lotus of Siam from now on. Don't waste your time here. Go to Lotus of Siam.

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Right there in the same ballpark as lotus but different specialties. Excellent wine list and I highly recommend simply asking the waiter to bring what's best for the night. Amazing oysters

We wanted to try  something new and outside the strip. Found this jewel on a list called Best Las Vegas Restaurants: Secret Spots Where The Locals Eat. This place will not disappoint! They have great friendly service and very attentive. The ambiance is low light kinda romantic! The food is great! I highly recommend the spicy duck rice and the drunken noodles!

I love the food here but the service seriously went down hill. This place use to make you feel like you had fine dining services with affordable prices.

I came here two days in a row and both times the service was not that great. 

The first night...
Jen Z and I came here on a Friday night and it was pretty busy. We placed our order and it took forever for anything to come out. The parties that came in after us even received their whole meal before us. Finally we got our pad hed and it was undercooked! It wasn't even hot. The Brussel sprouts were so raw and hard. The whole dish was also so salty that we had to send it back.

When they "fixed it", it ass overlooked! The brussels sprouts were soggy and lost its crunch. Everything else we order tasted great. 

The second night...
I came with my boyfriend and friend and it wasn't busy at all. My only complaints were that the server kept eaves dropping and budding in on our conversations. Also one of the servers poured my hoegarden into my boyfriends beer? 

Take out next time for me.

They have very good vegetarian pad thai.
Not very expensive.
Look fancy though.
Thank you for the delicious food :)
Amazing food and service. I was a little nervous because if never heard of it but man  this place blew my socks off!

Seriously some of the best Thai food in Las Vegas. I eat here at least three times a month. Everything on their menu is amazing and the staff is always friendly. Good food for takeout too!!

I always get pad kra pow chicken with white rice. THE BEST!!!!! Also really good pad see ew with chicken!! The crab curry is also really good, but spicy!! Spicy herbs spring roll is good too, but not very spicy. 

Definitely would recommend Chada Thai to anyone. Seriously one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Vegas!!!!
Food was okay. But the portion of Pad Thai was the smallest I have ever seen in my life for 10 BUCKS!!! Not worth it for the average taste.

The Goods
1. Pad Thai is my staple and it was sooo good!
2. The specialty this day was a shrimp and it had a great punch of umami!!  Tangy and plump juicy shrimps without any breading
3. Didn't have a chance for the wine but I'm sure it goes well with the food and had a lot of variety 

Service 
1. Overall nice
2. Check in and get seated 

Ambiance 
1. Small and not much seating 
2. Didn't have to wait long to be seated 
3. Table aide service and cashier 

MoJo
1. Go for a fancier than average taste of Thai cuisine.

With all the hype I've heard of this restaurant, I had to see what it was all about. It's definitely a nice romantic place for dinner. Small place which makes it very cozy. I can't say the food really stood out from the other Thai restaurants I've eaten at which makes me give it 3 stars. I'll give it another try again.

It was delicious and they even brought out Thai chilis for me to pop one in my mouth as a dare which was followed by some refreshingly delicious Thai tea! Loved the raw oyster with the mushroom "caviar"

The Skinny: bland pad thai but overall okay cuisine  (2.5) service: poor - complained about an under cooked item and the restaurant staff ignored the issue altogether (1) value: although the food is okay, the lilliputian sized dishes and exorbitant prices make this place a no-go for me ... oh yeah , they also charge $1 for rice(2).

My hubby was scouring online for all the new restaurants that were going to hit Las Vegas and hit on Chada Thai - a tapas style Thai food joint. Opened by a former employee of Lotus of Siam, this place was on his immediate "need to go" list. So we went on opening day and I believe we were one of their first customers in the restaurant.  (FYI - John Curtas just edged in before us.).

Now let me get this straight - I'm a little leery when someone tells me it's a "tapas" place. Because my brain translates this to - "we're going to give you 50% less food  but only reduce the price by 20% so you can 'share' and try more things." It's a FOS total cash grab marketing scheme of which Chada Thai is no exception.
