We ordered approximately 10 items for 3 people (including two $1 bowls of  rice which they charged extra for) which ended up being about $82.16 pre-tip and left the restaurant hungry. Yeah - we left f&(king hungry and s&*ting gold f&*king bricks afterwards.

We ordered two vegetable dishes - a grilled eggplant dish and a stir-fried mushroom dish. The grilled eggplant ($8) consisted on half of an eggplant marinated in kind of a green papaya salad type dressing. The flavor combination was nice however the grilled eggplant was a little bit tough texturally. The stir-fried mushrooms ($8) consistent of 2-3 different mushrooms with a sliver of lotus root and 1 brussel sprout mixed in. You heard me -1 brussel sprout. There was too little wok hai to the dish and hence the dish was swimming in too much liquid. The flavor was alright but nothing special.

The braised pork belly ($8) had a nice melt in your mouth texture and good flavor. However there were only 5 small slices of meat to go around.

The kai tod (garlic fried chicken) was good ($10) and one of the surprisingly more reasonably priced items on the menu. They actually gave you a large portion of the cornish game hen. The meat itself was tender while the outside was crispy and well seasoned.

Pad see ew ($6) was one of their better dishes of the night - good flavor with some good crisping of the rice noodles. Their pad thai ($7) though was one of the worst dishes. It was a little unusual for the rice noodle dish to be completely encased in a omelet but we went with it. The omelet was a little bit tough from the overcooked egg while the noodles were completely bland. Not recommended.

We also ordered the steamed sea bass with the plum sauce ($18) which I found to be a little too sweet for my tastes. I would not order this again.

Massaman curry ($9) had a nice flavor however was devoid of any real amount of vegetables or meat in the stew. Literally 2 chicken drumsticks, half of a raw small potato and perhaps half an onion.

Oh and about that raw potato -- so we informed the manager/owner? that the potato in the dish was raw. His response - "but the chicken is cooked, right?". "Yes." And that was it. He did not offer to correct the problem or even acknowledged that it was an issue at all as long as the chicken was cooked.  He didn't even offer an apology for incorrectly cooked food. That is poor customer service and speaks to the inexperience of the staff that work there.

Although I appreciate that we went on opening night, I have to say for really hit or miss quality Thai food (I would perhaps get maybe 3 out of the 8 items we ordered again) at over the top pricing for the small portions I would probably not return. However with the added poor service response, I would recommend avoiding this place like the f&*king bubonic plague. 2 starred review.

At the time we went, they didn't have a liquor license but they allowed BYOB without charging corkage fees. Woop de doo.
Curry was very amazing and creamy. Price was very reasonable!  Wine by the glass slightly more limited, many options for bottles. Smaller more romantic restaurant with very attentive servers!

I'm going to keep this simple;

The food is absolutely incredible and has ruined every other Thai place for me.  I live about half an hour away from Chada and literally wouldn't waste a Thai meal anywhere else.
Love the crunchy beef and crab curry. Quiet, intimate, and extensive wine selection. Definitely recommend for a nice thai dinner out.
My bf has been in Thailand and he considered this place as authentic!!! I just know it was delicious food.... completely recommended and good prices for the quality of the plates!!!

I called for a reservation and the hostess said there were two tables open. I told her I would be there in 15 minutes but she would not reserve the table. When I arrived 5 tables were empty. I was then told it would be a 30 minutes wait. They then said they only take 15% reservations & 85% for walk ins. Although the food is great it's not great enough to deal with their arcane reservation/walk in policy.

Wowzers!!! this place was incredible! I place an order for pick up by accident, I thought this place was Chada Street which is on Spring Mt. Well I am so glad I made that mistake because I had the most delicious Tom Yum soup I have ever had in my life! They didnt ask me how spicy i wanted it which I thought was odd but its because they have respect for their recipes. It had a bit of a kick but nothing spicy it was perfect and so tasty. I also ordered the pad thai with shrimp and I was surprised how big the shrimp was and they gave me a big portion. 

Chada please do not change your recipes or your portion sizes. Thank you for a wonderful dinner next time I will stop by and dine in. The lady that took my phone call order was also very very nice.

The appetizer wings were amazing! I ordered the beef pad Thai and my bf had the chicken pad Thai and I must say it was the best pad Thai I've ever had anywhere! The place was small and very cute/romantic. Definitely a great date night spot!

Great Food * Great Presentation  * Authentic, intimate atmosphere. The Panang Curry is spicy & delicious. Pla Nua Tod is bomb ~ authentic thai food. Great place to hit after Tiki, they are open until 3:00 am!!!

I hope my bad experience will give insight on why not to go to this thai location! Out of , around 5 thai cuisines, unfortunately we chose this one and we totally regret it. We are first among 10 other groups who took a seat and was last to receive food, after several times probing them, for which they answered with one word: "first-come-first-serve". We were never approached until we received food (which felt hours!) and finally we were charged with a flat 20% gratuity (we are a party of 4!). We asked them why and they responded with what we call "text-book definition of racism". The answer being: "we added the gratuity because we thought that a person, who was here before did not tip us, happen to look like you" and the bad part is the woman still argues about it! The way they answered our questions and the way behaved is in-explicable, and totally spoiled our mood! I am attaching the bill here for you to have a look! Don't get fooled with all positive reviews, there are many genuinely great thai cuisines around to try!
Delicious, reasonable prices, cool decor, great wine list & stays open late. Highly recommend.

We had a party of three arrive at 10:30 PM on a Saturday night.  We ordered soup and two appetizers and told the waitress we were still looking at entrees and requested the aforementioned order to be placed.  We decided on three entrees and ordered at the server's next pass.  The soup arrived first and this version of Tom Kah Kai was overpowering in citrus.  If the soup had been hot it might have been passable, but the soup was certainly prepared fresh and hot, but then plated in a cold bowl and then portioned in individual cold bowls for our party of three.  By the time we took the first spoonful, the soup was merely warm.  As we were eating the soup the two appetizers arrived.  Shortly after, while still eating the soup and prior to a single bite of appetizers, all three entrees arrived.  As the three dishes were being placed on the table I asked if they usually serve all the food at the same time.  The server laughed and smiled and I said it really wasn't funny as I had ordered in courses and now all the food would be cold by the time I was able to eat it.  He asked what I wanted him to do and I told him to do whatever he wanted.  He took two of the three entrees away and said he would have them prepared after we finished the soup and appetizers.  Not sure why only two of three but I told him to do whatever he wanted.

When the entrees arrived for a second time, they were served on stone cold plates along with the rice, which is extra, served in a cold bowl with no covering.  So despite the efforts to bring the food when we were actually ready to eat it, this restaurant showed how poorly food can be presented and amateur hour at its best.
I will say that two of the items ordered, the oyster appetizer and the curry crab entrée, were exceptional for taste and quality.  The fact that all the hot items were so poorly presented, and initially presented all at once, really shows what little this management knows about proper service.  This was my one and only trip to Chada and I will drive a few extra minutes to eat at Lotus where they know how to run a restaurant.  At Chada prices, it is somewhat offensive to be charged extra for white rice and for hot tea.

Came two days in a row. Both times were good but the pat see yew on the 2nd day was mushy and didn't look like noodles. Either they used the broken pieces from the bottom of the bag or they burnt it and scraped it off the pan. Attentive service and interesting choice is music.

WOW! This was hands down the best Thai food I have ever eaten. We ordered the oysters, shrimp satay, spring rolls, soft shell crab, pad Thai, and chicken fried rice. I can't even explain how amazing this food was, but the service was even better. Dirty plates swapped out for new ones after every course, water filled as soon as you take a few sips, and servers constantly asking you if you are enjoying the food. We were so well tended to and had a beyond amazing experience. We didn't leave one bite left! We also got the sweet sticky rice, mango, and coconut ice cream for dessert. Amazing, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! If you are in Vegas, you MUST eat here!

Amazing Thai food. Every dish we ordered was so much better than any other Thai restaurant I've ever been to. The service was great. My water cup was never empty and our food came out hot and fresh. I even made a comment to one of my friends that my nose was running from the spicy food and one of the waiters overheard and brought me paper napkins-so nice!
The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was because for our party of 5 people they added on gratuity for a "large party". The gratuity was over 20%. The restaurant was only half full at any given time and for only a party of 5, I don't think a gratuity added by the restaurant was warranted.

This place was bombalicious.

Came here with a party of 5 close to 10 p.m. on a Saturday night. We practically had the restaurant to ourselves.

Ordered a bunch of appetizers, entrees, and desserts. All delicious, but the item that I thought stood out the most was the PANANG CURRY. For 9 bucks, dam that is some good stuff. Great selection of wines... the som their recommended a great Italian wine that was delicious. Found out that it was only $35 when the bill came.

Great food at very reasonable prices... just can't beat it. Place is open till 3 a.m. but a little bit far off the strip.
Great small plates with excellent flavored. Extensive reasonably priced wine list as well.
There was no Chilean Sea Bass even though it was on the menu. They explained that it sold out the night before but that's not my fault. They should put it under the specials if that's the case .

We heard this place was good and it did not disappoint. The servers were friendly and accommodating. They had a gluten free menu with so many options. I was pleasantly surprised. I don't remember what I got, but it was delicious! We will be coming here again.
Food 5 stars, service 3 stars, if you don't want to wait for a table -  make a reservation. Crying tiger appetizer and duck entree was delicious!

Great service 
Lobster drunken noodles -five stars 
Crab Curry- wow! Most amazing Thai dish I've ever had! 

Wine selection was great and fairly priced! Can't wait to go back!

Amazing amazing amazing !!!!!!!
Try the beef jerky 
Egg rolls 
Rib eye salad 
Coconut soup with shrimp 
Friend rice with shrimp 
Desert coconut ice cream with sticky rice

Everything is incredible every single time !!!

I'm a devoted Lotus of Siam fan, and decided to give Bank's place a try. The food was excellent. Wines were great too, but the wine selection was small compared to Lotus. I was bummed there were no old Rieslings. Decor is more modern than Lotus. It's a toss up.

Sorry for posting this review almost after a year.
Some memories can not be forgotten and some people can not be forgiven.

f u visit Vegas for fun, dont get that spoiled by visiting this place.

Place is decorated and well maintained.
But people are not trained or manners less.

The check was included with gratuity and we were only 4. When asked about it the waitress said " Indians doesn't tip. So I included it in the Cheque".

Racist and unethical behaviour.

I wanted to love it.  I always thought that Lotus of Siam needed someone who worked there to open a similar place. I was excited that it was their sommelier who by all accounts is a wonderful guy.  So with excitement we went on a Saturday. We "scored" reservations at 6.  We were the only people in the restaurant. They said "it gets busy at 7".  By 7 there was one other couple. By the time we left, there was still just one other couple. 

The appetizers were great and creative. The meal itself was okay but nothing to write home about.  

I'm disappointed because I really wanted to love it, but it just didn't have the vibe, didn't have the food, and since we're not drinkers, we couldn't comment on the wine.

I would give this place 10 stars if possible! Loved the food and it was truly authentic Thai. Service was amazing... very attentive, quick and cordial. This place is open till 3am, which is a huge bonus. We showed up around 2am and couldn't be more happier with everything!

Where to begin... My girlfriend and I absolutely LOVE this place. We visit up twice a week whenever possible. 

Staff: They're awesome! We're regulars and T always treats us like family. He remembers what we drink and what we eat. In the event we stray away from our norm, his recommendations are always on point and in line with what we're into! 

Food: If you're into Thai, Chada takes the crown. Comparing it to other spots locally like Lotus and Natayas, Chada is above and beyond. Better tasting / quality food and nearly unbeatable prices. Their somewhat traditional Thai menu can please just about anyone. I recommend the Spicy Mushroom / Lemongrass soup (pronounced Tom Kah?), Drunken Noodles, and the Mango Sticky Rice (If it's available). 

Drinks: An awesome wine list, by the bottle or by the glass. My girl loves the Banshee Pinot by the glass! Beer list is small but has my favorite beer of all time. Very good Thai Tea as well.

Overall Ambiance: Sort of a hidden gem in a busy strip mall! Interior is classy and clam. It is small and intimate. Clean and welcoming! 

Thank you Chada! You guys rock.

I wasnt too impressed my first visit here... i did however decide to give it another try considering there isnt much option at 2am. Inhad a friendly waiter who suggested that i should order The DUCK PANANG CURRY... and it is to die for!! Must try it!! 

This place definitely puts Krung Siam to shame..! 

I will be back :)

Let's start with the service. Everyone was soo nice and attentive! The employees were very helpful with any questions about the menu and the gentleman who served us was very friendly. The food was amazing! We had tom yum soup, pad Thai, and salmon curry and everything was so good! The prices were very reasonable and the restaurant itself was very nice. Pretty small but it was nice. Definitely recommend it, can't wait to go back and try more of the menu!

With all the Thai restaurants in Vegas, it's hard to say which one is my favorite, but Chada is definitely up there with the best for me.  Hands down it is the best looking Thai restaurant in all of Vegas, they did a fantastic job with the inside.  It has a dark, wine bar feel to it.  Red glass chandelier hanging from the top, wine covering the back wall, and another wall filled w/ framed pictures.  You will be pleasantly surprised when you walk in.

Rib eye salad appetizer is money!!  (For all of you who do not understand the urban slang "money" it means 'of unusually high quality, very good.'  For example, Kobe Bryant is money).  The whole menu actually has rib eye options if you don't want their regular beef chicken, pork or shrimp.  Bless their hearts for not putting fatty rib eye either, I gotta give them that, it's money!!

The server recommended their grilled pork dish.  Also a money dish, big pieces of sliced grilled pork over a bed of Chinese broccoli.  Not a saucy dish by any means, very simple, but very satisfying.

Last recommendation was the crab curry.  It is served with three spirals of rice noodles.  Also a money dish, the crab is not over powered by the curry.  You definitely get the essence of the crab if that is your thing.  It doesn't have that strong flavor that you are used to in other curries like panang for instance.  It's a light dish, I would share it with friends, I wouldn't make it your main entree.

The least money dish was the drunken noodles.  Typical, sweet noodley dish you can get anywhere.  I would instead try the three dishes I mentioned earlier.

Perfect example of a restaurant having a decent rating and not a lot of reviews but still being excellent (or I should say money).  Yelpers do not be fooled by the reviews, I would make this the next Thai restaurant to go to, it is a hidden gem indeed.

We came here because Lotus of Siam was way too busy.  From the outside, it looks like a hole in the wall Asian restaurant, but the inside surprises me in a good way.  The service was excellent.  However, the food was o.k.  I have had better.  And the part that bothers me the most about this place is the portion size for the price.  Just beware that you may not feel full unless you order more than you would normally at other Thai restaurants!

What's a tired-from-work Vegan couple supposed to do when it's 11:30pm & we've got a hankering for Thai food? All the usual haunts are long closed, and the options are getting more limited by the minute...

Well, on a whim, we ordered a few things here (open until 3 & vegan options - don't bother looking for them on the menu, they aren't there, lol) & were pleasantly surprised!

The pad-see-ew tofu (vegan, no egg, no fish sauce) was seriously the best I've had in *YEARS*. Like, damn. It doesn't get better.

The pad thai (vegan, no fish sauce, no added veggies- that seemed weird to us) is not at all spicy, but was quite good nonetheless.

The fresh spring rolls (tofu) were unlike ANY other fresh roll I've had to date. Try them! They had some kind of very lightly pickled veg mix inside, which sounds gross, but they were really quite good. Very unique, but a nice change of pace.

The phone order went really smoothly, my order was done in 10-15min, and they had an understanding of their veganizing abilities, which is always a plus. I would love to go back on a date, as it really is a cute place with ambiance & the wine options are tempting. 

I will agree that the portions are really stupid small, guess they are trying to keep it upscale. But I'm still hungry. *sob*

Chada Thai and Wine goes for the upscale fine dining atmosphere and pulls it off well in my opinion.  The service is very professional, and the wine selection is very extensive.  I came here for lunch with a couple of friends and ordered the Tom Kha Khi ($8), Pad Kee Mao ($8), Sen Mee Kang Pou ($12), and Moo Hong ($8), all ordered hot. 

Overall the food was good.  I enjoyed the Pad Kee Mao (with pork) the most.  It had a really dry, herbal flavor to it.  The pork was moist and well prepared, and the veggies were plentiful and spot on.  The balance in flavor was well done while staying interesting with intense herbal flavor.  The Moo Hong (pork belly in a soy sauce) was good too, although it tasted kind of like a Japanese dish.  The pork was tender, perhaps slightly dry, but fatty and flavorful.  

I had mixed feelings about the See Mee kang Pou (crab curry on fermented rice noodles), and the Tom Kha Khi.  Both dishes used a peanut sauce to add sweetness, and I just am not used to that, especially in a Tom Kha.  Still, the flavors were nice and popping, although perhaps not super well balanced.  I could have done without the peanut sauce in either dish.  

This rating was a tough one for me.  I enjoyed the food well enough, and the wine selection was impressive.  However, the portions are definitely small.  The curry was served in a small bowl, the pork belly only had about 8 small bites.  The Pad Kee Mao didn't have a lot of noodles (a lot more veggies).  Although the Pad Kee Mao was a really fantastic dish, the others were around a 3-3.5 for me.  Combined with the low value of the smaller portions, I have to end up at about a 3/5.  Don't take my word for it though, this is still a good Thai restaurant worth trying!

Maybe it was high expectation with which we sat down for the first time in this subdued dining space.  My wife, who is a stickler for ambience, was pleased with her surroundings.  The service was mostly attentive.  I was distracted by less than perfect temperature of my wine by the glass.  Also was disappointed by lack of quality offerings by the glass.  The mushroom appetizer was WAY too salty - the pad thai less so but still quite distracting.  The crab curry served with noodles did not deserve any positive adjectives - had an off flavor and would not have recommended to any of my friends/family.  Doubt we'll return.

Discovered this place a few months ago, thanks to Yelp, and it's now my favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas.  I've taken a few friends and my mom here and they are now loyal addicts of this place.  We usually order the crispy beef (wonderfully tangy flavor...originally the wait staff's recommendation when we asked what was popular...and now frequently order it).  One thing to note though about the crispy beef, if you have wheat/gluten sensitivity like I do, this dish might make you bloated or hurt your stomach.  I think the coating might have some flour in it.  Some days I decide to take the discomfort for the amazing dish....if I were on a first date, probably not.  Around my boyfriend, I don't care.  All else, I've never had any reaction to.  In the past, have ordered the onion/mint/lime/fish sauce-flavored  pork larb, green curry, mussamun curry (which is their closest to "yellow curry"...Mussamun being closer to a Persian version, or at least that's what the name means), Pad Kee Mao and appetizer Miang Puo.  I can't think of a dish that has disappointed.  A lot of times, there will be maybe one dish that is "okay" but this place takes trophies for all the dishes we've had so far.  It's impressive.   I've ordered for pick-up as well and had smooth transactions.  The wait staff have all been wonderful and timely for the most part.  Not a bad experience sticks out.  The price is higher for the smaller serving...maybe you pay for what you get?  I watch my budget so don't eat here as frequently as I wish I could because of the price....but nonetheless, it's been satisfying in terms of excellent cuisine and service.  Me and my guests have never ordered wine so unable to review that portion.  We usually call for reservations because although many posters say it's empty, on a Friday or weekend day, it can fill up fast.  I've seen parties come in unable to be seated.  I'm so hungry after writing this, I'm going to go there tonight now....

Really good dishes.

Deep fried prawns with sauce vs Lotus of Siam Garlic Prawns.   I think Chada is better priced but the Lotus of Siam (LoS) Prawns taste better.  The sauce at Chada is good but it takes away from the flavor of the prawns.

For a party of six, 7 dishes was barely enough, we could probably have gone with 9 dishes.  I would double up on any dishes that you like.  We got 2 prawn dishes but 5 single dishes.  The dishes are really small here so you can't go for seconds in a large party.

Pad See Ew is also better at LoS.

Drunken noodles were good also.

Parking lot is packed.  And usually you have to hound for a spot.

One star because I couldn't even eat there. Walked in alone & there were a half a dozen empty tables. Hostess grabbed menus & said how many ? When I replied one, she said oh I'm sorry we don't have any tables because of reservations. Well you had a table if it was more than one person, didn't you ?  I probably would have eaten & been out without any issue of taking a table needed for another party. But the hostess chose to lose a very probable regular customer. Who would have generally been a party of 2 or 4.  The owner may have super business now, but as is well known in the restaurant industry, repeat clientele will dictate your survival. Declining business is usually a very bad business concept. I ate next door at your competitor, spending $50 plus tip. When I was done you still had 3 empty tables. Good luck with that business model.

What a place. 
I came in with two friends and we were not immediately sat down since it turns out I came in "during rush hour." 
I waited one hour for a table and was allowed to make reservations for a table in one hour: we went to the foot spa in the same plaza as we waited. 
I recommend a reservation as there is limited seating space. 
I came in with two of my friends and we ordered a salmon, vegetable rolls, yellow potato chicken curry, chicken pad Thai, and a coconut curry soup. 
Our minds were BLOWN. 
When you walk into a restaurant and read a menu, there is a description next to the item: we could identify the BOLD flavors in EVERY bite of EVERY plate. 
Absolutely amazing plates. 
Absolutely incredible wait staff.

Absolutely without a doubt the best Thai in Vegas and most likely LA. A must try! The food was outstanding, the menu laid out perfectly and the service was excellent! I have the Panang  and it was superb. The wine list is stellar. We also have the Cornish hen, perfect, the massaman was right on spot and the pork belly was unreal! Give their place a shot. Lotus of Siam which is considered very good and a must try had just been over thrown in Vegas and this place blows it away. I will be frequenting Chada!

The service was deplorable, and the food was mediocre. 
We were greeted by a gentleman who, instead of being welcoming, just asked us to
"Hold a minute". 
The food was none the better. The menu detailed an appetizer completely different from what we received. We took one bite of it, just terrible. 
Finally, our waitress disappeared and all the other waiters seemed to carry on without a worry. Mind you, there were maybe, five other people in the establishment. Just terrible.

Loveeee it here, adorable little restaurant hidden in the middle of a strip mall. I would have never tried it from the look of the outside if it weren't for a recommendation from a friend... it's a hidden gem for sure. Everything I've tried is wonderful here! The decor is classy and upscale

The ambiance was very romantic and the service was great. Our waters were refilled as soon as one sip was taken. The food came out quickly. I would recommend the spicy duck rice which was my favorite entree. The spring rolls were a good appetizer, and they tasted very fresh!

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!  It is small and dark and has great wine list. The food is always good and frankly I'm addicted to a few things. Fresh spring roll is ridiculously good have it twice! Duck panang or drunken duck noodles also a favorite. The short rib beef rice super spicy and pork Larb. Those are my everyday items.  It's open late which is great.

I am so glad I found this place.  Very cute, small, modern interior with kind servers.  The menu features creative dishes which made it hard to choose just one.  This isn't the type of Thai place where you order crab rangoons and pad see eww.  I ordered the crab curry and I could have easily devoured 3 entrees of it since it was so delicious.  For the quality of the food, I was very impressed on the reasonable prices.  Keep in mind this place is only open from 5pm until 3am.  I will definitely be back!
Ate there twice recently.  Excellent food, wine and service both times.  Great value.

Best thai food in las vegas period. Might be my favorite restaurant in all areas.
Been here 3x now and each time seems to be better. We love Lotus of siam but the quality of the food here seems to be top standards. Soups and fish dishes are amazing.

Seriously, the best spring rolls, and crab curry. Some of the items are served at the spice level the chef makes it, and I love that. The chef knows best, and is not willing to compromise. I came here once and sat across from Elijah Wood. I can't say enough about this place. Love it!

Chada Thai was recommended by friends that are in the restaurant industry. We went in on a Saturday night to try them out.

The service was good and very knowledgeable. Started with the fried oysters - wonderful presentation and even better flavors. Next we had the Yum Nua (ribeye salad) which was equally good. The Sen Mee Kang Pou (crab curry) was outstanding. All of the flavors were yummy. The portions were a little small, so we ordered the Pad Thai to finish the meal.

Will definitely be back!!!

Overall, this restaurant was very nice. The food was excellent and the service was superb! Jon was very nice and very attentive.  The restaurant it self is casually quaint. We will definitely come back again. However, we notice that the blond? Asian hostess was greeting ever guest on the table expect us. What's up with that? I think was very rude and cheeky.

I ordered the Panang Curry, spicy eggrolls, papaya salad and Pad Kra-Pow with Ribeye. Everything was delicious. My favorite was the Panang Curry, meat was tender and the waiter recommended a great wine to go with the spice levels of the dishes. I would go back if I lived in Vegas.

Tasty Tom yum!! Portions are kinda small but service is great. We ordered, shrimp pad Thai, chic drunken noodles and large tom yum. Only down side was we got stomach ache the next day and had to take turns using the bathroom  Probably won't return but glad we tried their food.
best drunken noodles in town. there ingredients  are the best. sometime the service is slow but overall best Thai food in town for sure!
Hella good! I forgot what we got but everything was dope. Just a reminder to myself to come back.

Chada Thai and Wine has taken my top thai restaurant spot in Las Vegas.  Friendly and attentive service, nice interior design and the food is inventive and flavorful - takes classic thai dishes and adds a unique and artisanal quality to them.  Great wine, beer and sake options as well.
Very good food and service. The duck panang and spicy spring roll are very delicious. We will definitely come back!
Absolutely the best Thai food in Las Vegas! Very small but very elegant. Their food is amazing and I live their wine list. Servers are always nice and helpful. Great service!

A broad menu executed wonderfully 
with a sophisticated flair.   The modest dining room is well done as well...very pleasant place to site...albeit intimate.  No language barriers and service was on point.  But the food...best Thai meal I think I have had in this town....everything excellent.  It felt a step above Lotus of Siam at half the price.

Bank (owner) used to be the wine manager at Lotus of Siam.. he's now opened Chada.  well a lot of the legendary dishes have carried over from Los to Chada.

The decor is more modern and clean. The food is as exceptional as LoS.  The wine program while not as epic as LoS before is very versatile and functional and has some nice value finds.

If you have Bank cook for you, you will not be disappointed.

It's now a must go for us when we are in Vegas.

We usually go to Lotus of Siam but this place is open later with way less crowds to fight. The first couple times I went here I didn't review. The foods was SO good this time I had to. 

We came with friends visiting from AZ for late night (haha late for me is 9:45pm). Great wine selections just like Lotus and the food is similar but with a twist. We got the crispy garlic prawns but Chada's had yummy tamarind flavor. The special dish was fried salmon....you can't imagine how crispy it is. The Thai beef salad was AMAZING. Super spicy and the sauce was outstanding. Everything we got was seasoned so well. The only thing I didn't care for was the cold summer roll app. It had SO much ginger (to be fair, I'm not a ginger lover).
Chada has authentic Thai foods....mostly southern Thai dishes. Delicious.....dont miss!!!

Our favorite thing to do is try these hidden little places in funky little shopping plazas. You can really be surprised and find someplace amazing.

Chada Thai is just that kind of place! The thai food is really excellent! Every dish we had brought to the table was impressive, full of flavor and beautifully plated!

Definitely make reservations, it is a tiny dining room. 
But worth it.

My previous review stated that I enjoyed their spring rolls, so I had my roommate order me some when she went to get take out for some noodles. She asked specifically for vegetarian options, and my spring rolls still came with pork. Nbd, but generally a server should advise the customer that meat comes in an item they're ordering when they are specifically asking for vegetarian. The issue comes in when they didn't seem all too happy about switching it out. In her noodles it was also paaaaaccckked with  tofu, which I also wouldn't normally complain about, but you could barely even see any noodles in comparison. When I went back to grab the proper rolls (which probably took a solid 10/15 min of waiting, even though I called ahead about the problem) , they ironically were also receiving a health walk, and got a B grade. Now I definitely will not be returning.

I've never even left a review on Yelp, but my food was so gross that i seriously gave it to my dog. It was just simple Pas Thai. It tasted like someone burned the crap out of it. It was so bad! My dog did eat it though. Never again!

Wife took me here and I haven't stopped thinking about this amazing place ever since.  It's a hidden gem in a place surrounded by karaoke bars and usual Asian food venues.  We didn't even see it until we were right at the door.  It literally is a bit hidden.  So we go in and we enter a whole 'nother place.  It was very urban, but sophisticated.  Like a restaurant I've seen on the strip or an upscale Japanese restaurant.  

If you come here, do not leave without trying the Kai-Yang (cornish hen) it is simply divine.  They have one of the best Pad Thai I've ever had here in Las Vegas.  It's a hit for me.  I can't wait to go back and try the other menu items.
Even though it says it's open till 3... it isn't...got there before 2 and it was closed

Ordered from Postmates and they not only forgot the rice with my curry, but the portion was super skimpy for $10. The potion for the drunken noodles was also really small $9.00. The thom kha was absolutely delicious and the portion was better than the other two for $9. Overall I don't know if I'd order from them again even though the food was good.

Nice place for a Thai dinner in Vegas.  Wine selection is good with nice stemware.  Service was friendly and attentive from start to finish.  Food was mostly authentic with the standout being pad see ew.  Fun to try this place although I think I still like Lotus of Siam better.

Very happy we tried this place out. When we arrived there was not many people in there which was great as we were seated immediately. Our server was named Jay and she was amazing !!!
She was on top of everything and super friendly. 
I order the papaya salad with no nuts spicy level 8. Very delicious just wished it had the green beans like a traditional papaya salad does for extra crunch. Then we had the crispy prawns in this wonderful curry sauce (sorry forgot the name) man it was so delicious. The bf had this meat thing which I did not try as I do not eat meat. But I can seriously go back again today and get me more of them crispy prawns.

This Thai restaurant actually has an ambience. I ordered the pad-kra pow ribeye steak which I would normally not order from a Thai restaurant and the Thai fried rice. Both dishes were well seasoned and tasted like they were made from quality ingredients. 

Chada is the best quality Thai food and ambiance I have come across in Las Vegas.

Unbelievably delicious meal here. The value this little gem offers is fantastic- Thai cuisine to the delicious wine.We came during the week and had outstanding service and a terrific time. The lettuce wrap with crab meat and ginger kicked it off and we had a great meal all the way through to the rib eye finish! And if the meal itself was not even enough don't leave with out a pot of tea and a Thai sundae! Don't be scared the hot dog bun makes it.  Give it a shot you are gonna love it!

The food gets 4 stars, but I have to subtract one star for weird takeout service.  

I stopped by one night to get takeout and when I was placing my order, I was asked for my name, which didn't seem necessary but that was fine.  Then they asked me for my phone number and address, which really didn't make any sense since I was standing right there.  When I asked if they really needed my phone number and address, I was told they couldn't put in an order without a phone number and address.  That makes no sense to me at all.

Looking at pictures of the food and seeing the different presentations for the same dishes and how I experienced my own dishes tells me that Chada lacks consistency, which is something important to people who would want to become regulars. I suppose that shouldn't be a problem for me.

As others have mentioned the sommelier from Lotus of Siam opened this place, so many people expect this place to be similar to LOS. It's not. It also doesn't have to be. But it should be good and reasonable. The flavors were good.

I ordered the

Lettuce Wrap: 5 small pieces of lettuce with crab, crispy garlic, a Thai bird chili slice and some sauce in the middle, delicious yet not filling. Referring back to location, I think it's safe to say that it affected my thinking because anywhere else in Chinatown where I would order lettuce wraps, one lettuce wrap would have been equivalent to the five little ones combined. However, that said, I would say that lettuce wrap was enjoyable.

I also tried the 

Pork Belly: 5 slices of almost-tender belly, balanced in fat and lean meat, but lacking in melt-in-your-mouth texture and smoothness. The dish was well-seasoned.

I was surprised (unpleasantly) by the

Massaman Curry: 2 chicken drumsticks, two pieces of onion, and 2 pieces of potato with only enough curry to dress the morsels of food. There was no rice included. I have never had curry served without rice. Curry is meant to be eaten with some carbs. I ordered a side of white rice. I recommend that the staff should put the rice in a small bowl then cup that bowl of rice into the bowl they are serving it in, so the rice looks presentable and appetizing. The way the rice was served shows lack of experience.

Maybe all they need is time and a couple of reviews to help them out. There are many great places for Thai food. I don't know if I will be back considering their price to reason ratio. Their food and ambiance were good - just not good enough with the other places out there.

We went back to have dinner early last evening (Saturday around 5:15 pm). There were 2 other groups eating.

I, the old curmudgeon who wants to enjoy dinner at least 24" from the next person's body, was thrilled to have the server place us exactly midpoint between others in bench seating and she took away the place settings of the four person table where we sat. The tables were placed an appropriate distance apart.

I like privacy and space and so this was great for me. Married to a guy who wants to join everyone else's conversation it is difficult to find respect for space.

Well we knew we already liked the food last time. This time it was great! My husband loved the spicy crab curry and a pad thai. I thought the pad thai was one of the best ever. I ordered the grilled tilapia with spicy garlic and mint sauce. Sauce is to die for! One of the owners offered to filet my fish which made it much easier. We gulped down shrimp satays and shrimp cakes for appetizers.

The wine list is good but you can only get certain kinds by the glass. I wanted a Schneider riesling wine but accepted a New Zealand sauvignon blanc. He had 2 Singha beers. We spent about $82 without the tip.

Early is good for space and quiet and privacy.

Bring a huge flashlight or download a good flashlight app because it is really dark and you may want to read the menu first.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in town. From the Chu Chee Prawn and Crab Curry to the Pad Sie Euw and Duck Panang, I've been known to eat 3 dinners in a row here. Service has always been solid but I enjoy takeout just as much. I don't eat out very often but when I do, I come here.

How could you not give 5 stars to the BEST thai food in the city with an awesome wine menu? 
The prices on the wine list are literally unbeatable in Vegas, and they have some really good options. 
I love everything I have tasted on the menu, but there are some things I need to get every time I come here. The crab curry (super hot and the level can't be adjusted, but worth it!), the cornish hen (deep fried.. yum), the pad see ew and the papaya salad. 
When I'm craving thai, I thank god for this place... the only restaurant in Vegas I can go to satisfy my craving!

I've been there twice now and both times were amazing! The service is wonderful and they're very friendly. We didn't have reservations both times but went pretty early in the evening so we were sat right away. Last time I had their oysters and I'm pretty sure they're the best oysters I've ever had. I also had the lobster in curry sauce and that was delicious. I would definitely go back even though I live on the other side of town!

Service wasn't perfect but I really liked the food. 
Spicy like real Thai should be and not apologetic to make it more subtle for the western taste

SO much better than lotus of Siam. It's a small restaurant and the attention is clear in the food . Loved the crispy prawns, Panang curry, fried rice, and drunken noodles. Best Thai I've had in Vegas .

Great service and food. They have a large selection of authentic Thai choices, as well as items with a contemporary twist. Although I agree with others that the portions are on the smaller side, it's not like we really need to be eating all we can eat to begin with. The waiter suggested we try three different appetizers and they were all spot on. 
The service was great and we never had to ask for anything as it was always offered to us beforehand. I would definitely come here again.

Ahhhhhhhhhh-mazing! My husband and I were driving around and decided to stop by this small Thai restaurant, since it was late and they close at 3am. We walked in and it's a small,nice place... We ordered and the service was great, but the food .. Out of this world! BY FAR, the beat Thai food in town. There wasn't a thing I wouldn't recommend; from their hot jasmine tea- to their lettuce wraps. Delicious! I'm hungry again, just writing about it! Also, great place for date night!
Wine is stored improperly...squid was rubbery... Guys room temperature means 55 degrees... Not Las Vegas... France during harvest. 2 staff members very rude...

I always enjoy my meals at Chada Thai & Wine.  Don't judge this restaurant by its location in an uninviting shopping center.  You walk in and the atmosphere and decor is great.  I have never had a problem reserving a table at this place in the few times I've been here.

When dining here, we usually order a bunch of different dishes and try them all.  They also change their spiciness based on the diners' request.  I love spicy and Chada does not disappoint in that department.  Their Pad Thai is exceptional and all other dishes are very good as well.  

The prices are the only reason Chada Thai & Wine is not a 5 star in my book.  I recommend trekking to this outstanding restaurant if you want to leave the strip and experience a Thai meal worthy of the cuisine

Horrible experience. We paid $30 to take a taxi here from all the way across town and they basically said we're not interested in serving you. When we arrived the hostess gave us the cold shoulder, and the head waiter (bald Asian guy) said and I quote...."we can't serve you, we're too busy", I said "what about those two tables right there, they can easily seat 5", he responded with "even if we seat you we won't be able to help you for awhile because we are too busy". I managed a restaurant for 4 years and I have never seen anything so ridiculous in my life. We left the restaurant extremely disappointed. Will never be back.

Chada does Thai food in a completely elevated but effortless way. I have yet to try something that I did not like. The staff is the most personable group of people. Chloe and Gap are buddies of my boyfriend and I, now, because we just keep coming back to see them! They know us by name and always make us feel welcome with a handshake and a hug. 
You haven't tried Thai food like this. I've had Lotus of Siam and was not very impressed. The quality of the dishes and the expertise of the servers makes for a truly special dining experience. Chloe and Gap know which wine pairs best with each dish and how every entree complements another. Panang Curry, pork Larb, pork belly Moo Hong... I can go on and on telling you what tastes great, which dishes are my favorite and what you should order... instead, just ask your server and you won't be disappointed.

Yet another STAR away from the strip. 
Thai cuisine with remarkable innovation and creativity. 
Relatively small place but with a big heart and soul. 
We wanted a relatively small meal and my daughter and I decided to try the fried quail eggs, spring rolls and shrimp curry with noodles (see pictures). Beautiful presentation and excellent flavors. 
A visit to a Thai restaurant almost always seems incomplete without the obligatory mango and sticky rice. Well, it did not let us down. 
The service was efficient and attentive. It was not just your obligatory "sawatdee". These guys make you feel welcome and we had another experience that was memorable. 
By the way, this restaurant is located in Las Vegas's Chinatown. 
Looks like Vegas Chinatown is becoming a hot spot for people with a hankering for good food!

This place is a little hole in the wall paradise that we found and did not know existed.  One of the best things is open til 3am. The food's taste is surprisingly good.  Drunken noodles,  coconut soup and the dessert, has nothing to envy lotus of Siam. I forgot,  the customer service is excellent!! There is someone ready to serve if they are not doing anything they will stay in the dining area standing and observing to make sure the clients have everything they need.  The atmosphere and decoration Is very modern matching and cozy.
Contemporary Thai. Pretty nice atmosphere in the heart of China town. We had drunken noodles and prawns curry. Tasty... Not as many wines by glass as we would expect from a wine bar.

I've been here a couple of times and I really enjoy it here. It's open very late so if you get a crazy Thai craving, come to this place. The food is really good and the wine list is very nice. They let you choose how spicy you want your food, which is great. The restaurant is really casual and simple, and the staff is super sweet. I highly recommend  Chada.

Tried this place for the first time after a few people on yelp recommended it and I was greatly impressed. 

The food was great and very reasonably priced, the menu was easy to interpret unlike a lot of Thai places and the waiter was very helpful he recommended dishes and explained what they were the restaurant was small but fancy but not too fancy even had candles at each table. its a great spot for a romantic night out on a budget or a casual dinner with the family sit next to the whine wall for a nice seating area

Me and the GF ordered a glass of whine each, an app (spring Rolls which were very good) one entree each (shrimp pad Thai w/ chicken only $2 more to add, and the Salmon in tom yum sauce and a side of flat rice noodles $3 everything was delicious) all for only $54

The restaurant was very clean also it was an overall great experience

So I'm writing this review not because I ate there which honestly I was really excited to eat here! But upon entering no one greeted me or my family, then when we asked for a table for 5, in the very empty place I might add, they said no we have a reservation at 8 for 50 people crazy huge but it's 5:30 when we entered and we weren't going to take 2 and a half hours to eat but alas we didn't get seated the two lady's that were helping us out kept looking at each other almost ignore us to I want to say just to make us leave. So we did not get great service what so ever and I don't yelp often I don't yelp bad reviews but just for me to step in here and say no I wouldn't come back is hard but I did it it's done my opinion
The place rocked , excellent service and menu and great wine list , the best part was when I got the bill how affordable it was for such a classy establishment , with a great ambiance

Great for date nights, or just hanging out with friends, Chada Thai has become one of my favorite spots in town. The space is cozy and intimate, with lighting that's dim but still bright enough so you can see your food and music that provides enough ambient noise to entertain without forcing you to raise your voice to carry a conversation.

If you're a fan of Brussels sprouts, the Pad Hed ($8) is a must try. The silky smooth quality of the sauce had hints of sweetness that enhanced the savoriness of the mushrooms, lotus root and Brussels sprouts.

A challenger for best dish at Chada Thai (at least from the ones I've tried) is the Moo Hong ($8). Tender cubes of pork were covered in a thick, subtley sweet and acidic sauce. I have no idea how they develop these flavors, but they're unlike anything I've had in town.

Wanting more heat, we tried the Nua nam tok ($12) -- charbroiled rib eye with rice powder, onion, cilantro, chili powder, fish sauce, and lime juice. Even ordering it as a mildly spicy dish it still produced a good bit of heat. The kind of heat that lingered in my mouth and lips and made my nose run.

On the more mild side, the Mussamun curry ($9) impressed with its depth and complexity. The pork in the Kana moo krob ($9) was reminiscent of the dish Lechon with it's crispy and crackly exterior, while the drunken noodles, chicken, and sauce in the Pad kee mao ($9) was perfectly balanced.

With dishes that will please those that love heat and those wanting a milder experience of Thai food, Chada delivers the best of both worlds in a spot perfect for locals and worth the drive as a dining destination for tourists.

Another best kept secret! GREAT food, great price point! Service was a bit wonky, but you better make reservations!!! This place is a challenge for parties larger than 4, it's REAL intimate but the food is worth the wait! I will definitely return!

This is the best Thai restaurant ever! The food is amazing! I've tried other Thai restaurants and this place is the best! The chicken pad see ew is amazing!!!!!! Best pad see ew ever!!! The customer service is great! They pack your food for you & pour your drinks for you

Wow! Just finished dinner at Chada Thai & Wine and it was phenomenal! We have tried many Thai restaurants here in Vegas and this one is my new favorite.

This place is small and the ambiance is dim, classy and romantic. 

They have impressive wine collections offering wine at reasonable prices with hardly a mark-up.

The menu focuses on food from Southern Thailand (including Bangkok). The prices are very reasonable, with most appetizers, soups, and curries hovering in the $8 - $23.

For appetizers, try
Spicy Herbs Spring Roll New: lettuce wrapped with ground pork with ginger, onion, lemongrass, and thai basil. It was flavorful and seemed healthy.

Yum Kai Nok Kata: a flavorful appetizer of fried quail eggs topped with dried shrimp, cilantro, and red onion tossed in a spicy lime dressing. Yummy!

For entree, try

Chuchee Cripsy Prawn: Deep fried Prawn served with chu-chee curry was divine. It was hot, juicy and full of flavor. Really enjoyed them.

Yum Woon Sen Seafood: Bean thread stir fry with tomato, onion, cilantro, chili, lime juice, and fish sauce. Also delish.

The staff are very friendly and serve the food fast.

All in all we really enjoyed our meal at Chada Thai & Wine.

If you would like to eat tough beef with your Pad See Ew, and undercooked chicken with your Panang Curry then look no further, this is the place for you!

Portion size was probably the most disappointing thing about Chada Thai & Wine beside the quality of the food served to us that evening.

It is located on Desert Inn and Jones in an older shopping center, but the interior is very quaint with modern feel. They have art on the walls and proudly display their wine collection for your viewing pleasure. We walked in and it took awhile to get greeted then seated, but we got our table eventually. Maybe I am too spoiled by big portions at all other thai restaurants, but when my Pad See Ew comes out and it is as big as a small bowl of rice, disappointment will quickly set in. I never knew that level 4 spiciness out of 5 could taste so mild.. I would like to believe it was an off-night for them and maybe I will try them again in the future.

Thai food is something I love to eat. My first experience with it was as a kid. I had a friend who's parents had been missionaries in Thailand. My friend always wanted to trade for my "normal" food and I was happy to have her exotic foods. I finally found a green curry with the same depth of flavor of my friend's mom at Chada. It was amazing. The pork has a nice citrus leaf marinade and the grilling gives it a nice caramelized flavor. The curry sauce was perfect and the dish was well balanced, like all Thai should be. It was not overly sweet, like most Americanized Thai tends to be. I also had the shrimp satay appetizer and still walked out of the restaurant under $25. I was a little disappointed that there was no wine by the glass. I was dining alone and driving, so no bottle for me. I would consider adding the option of a featured wine by the glass, for those who can't drink an entire bottle.

Chada offers a very unique Thai experience. This is not your typical fast Thai experience. Chada is a date night location with amazing service, presentation and Thai flavors on its menu. The small setting makes it very popular with local Vegas foodies so book a table or expect a wait.

We enjoyed our food here overall
Pork lab-I liked it but my daughter thought it was too sour

Thai iced tea- I loved it but wasn't sweet enough for her. Perfect for me since I find it too sweet at other places

Pad see ew - hubby loved it but I thought it was sweet

Duck Penang - duck awesome but for me sauce was too spicy. Wasn't spicy enough for hubby. He likes spicy

Tamarind chicken wings- our daughter loved it. A little sweet for me

Amazing food and service . Best thai food I've ever tried and service was excellent Pair was very attentive and friendly and her recommendations were on point .Would highly recommend sen mee kang pou its a crab curry w/rice noodles if u like spicy and seafood , pad thai noodles and tom yum koong soup we add mixed seafood for an upcharge but it was worth it . Prices are reasonable.

Authentic Thai food and good size portion. Cozy atmosphere. Family owned restaurant, who give their personalized attention to all guests.

Good food, nice place and good people

My go to Thai food place in Vegas. It's a low key spot off strip in an Asian strip mall with other Asian restaurants. You get a lot of value and better than any Thai food on the strip. They don't skimp on the flavors and ingredients. The pork Larb and the fried shrimp curry was our favorite stand out dish last night. They are also well known for the amazing wine list, especially Rieslings, which pairs perfectly with Thai food.

One of my coworkers said that this place was started by a chef who left lotus of Siam and went out on his own...so I Took some coworkers and friends who flew in from Ohio because I always loved lotus of Siam.  I had the pad Kra-pow (Thai basil stir fry) and it was amazing!  My girlfriend has the shrimp satay and a coworker had the lobster tail.  Everything was good.  We all had singha beer and wine and surprisingly it wasn't that expensive!  I'm not sure what everyone ate but all 7 of us really enjoyed it.  Finished with a stinky rice and mango dessert.  The only issue we had with this place is that they only allowed us 3 total checks for 7 and everyone wanted separate.  But it wasn't that big of a deal.  The ambiance of this place is great for a quiet date or a group of 4...7 was a lot but we all made it work.

I love all kinds of food but Thai Cuisine is my favorite. I came here to dry the crab curry that everyone raves about, unfortunately, I was told by the staff that it was extremely spicy and they couldn't adjust the heat level so I ended up ordering the green curry which was good. 

The sticky rice with ice cream was outstanding. 

It's a small place and the staff is good. The ambiance is nice and has a variety of wine selection. 

One thing however, surprised me. They charge you a buck fifty for the steamed rice.  I was told by the management that they were charging for the rice so they can stay competitive with their pricing. 

I don't believe it would make much of a difference if they raised a buck fifty for the rice entrees because the crowd they attract are wine lovers to whom a dollar fifty doesn't mean a whole lot. 

I look forward to coming back to try some of the other entrees. 

 I'd like to say one thing though. This place beats the pants out of Lotus of Siam which is totally over-rated.

Ever been to a Thai place with a sommelier?  Neither have I.  I knew I had to check this one out.  Chada is located off the beaten path, tucked away in a nondescript strip mall.  The outside is unassuming and rather bland.  The dishes however, are a stark contrast.  We told the waitress to surprise us.  Every dish that came out was colorful.  Some were old traditional dishes, and some were more innovative.  The execution on both were terrific.  Not to mention, we followed up with some terrific wine on their extensive wine menu.  This place is cool.  I give them props; they are doing something different here and the service and overall experience was great.

I typically dine at their sister location, the one called Chada Street, on Spring Mountain Road, but decided to come to this one on 9/20 for dinner.  This one seems higher end with the nicer decor and requisite ambiance. The staff are just as friendly at both locations and the menu & wine list are pretty similar. 
 Tonight I had the Spicy crab curry & the 
Grilled chicken appetizer.  I had a glass of the Turley old vine zin and a glass of the textbook cab.  
The wine and food were simply divine and the prices are not expensive at all.  I can't ask for much: good food at reasonable prices is fantastic to me.
One of the best meals I have had in vegas everything we ordered was very flavorful. From the outside doesn't look like much but nice ambience overall. This place is about to get very popular
Freshest, most flavorful Thai I have had. Don't let the outside surroundings fool you, this is a cool spot on the inside with a great and varied wine list. Absolutely terrific!!

this new hipster thai place is pretty good. been here twice so far, they got some really good appetizers. my fave is the lettuce cup wraps and the mushroom plate. the lettuce wraps are small and bite size and have great flavor. the mushroom plate has 3-4 different kinds of mushrooms. i love mushrooms (not drugs). other dishes that like are pad see eww, pad thai, and the lobster tail. all good. last time i went my gf ordered me a glass of wine. towards the end she tasted it and i guess it "oxidized" i didnt even know what the hell that tastes like but the server took off our tab. id definitely go back again especially since they are open late.

Great food!

Came for a work dinner one night and had a wonderful experience. We ordered about 8 dishes to share between 4 of us and not a single one was less than delicious. We did get the exotic dish of pig ear, heart and tongue and the meats were slightly overcooked which made them rather chewy. The beef jerky was seasoned well, and just the right amount of crispy and dryness for me. And of course, we got 2 of the sticky rice mango with coconut ice-cream dessert - absolute heaven! The service was friendly and attentive. 

The restaurant is such a lil hole-in-the-wall in a obscure strip mall next to a karaoke bar, so you can hear American Idol wannabe's next door while eating dinner, hilarious. Bathrooms are fairly clean and there's plenty of parking in the strip mall.
The food was served tapas style so I tried a variety of plates which were all very good. The honey toast desert is to die for. The overall ambience was nice. And the service was great.

A great little hidden Thai restaurant.   Enjoyed our first experience here.  Flavorful foods and nice ambiance.  Great service and attentive staff.  The place looks nicely decorated, simple and clean.  Not sure if they do reservation but no wait when we got here around 630 pm.  Shortly after that they was a bit of a wait.  Overall experience was great.

I've clearly never really had Thai food before, because this was easily the best Thai meal I've ever had.  Maybe my experiences have been super lackluster, but I'd rather think Chada is just that damn good.  I went for the second time last night with a group and everything was fantastic once again.  Particular stand outs were the duck, both soft shell crab dishes, the lettuce cups, fresh oysters and pad thai, easily the best pad thai I've ever tasted.  Just phenomenal!

The massaman and penang curry had a very familiar characteristic about them. Perhaps it's the saltiness or slightly chalky flavor that one can remember from a box preservative form of curry. The instant you put it into your mouth you know it's not made in house. The dark ambiance with the wine presentation is romantic and charming. The deep fried softshell crab and the whole grilled fish with the house made sauces are delightful. The pad thai noodles reminded us of a street vendor quality, below what we would expect. But sadly, we cannot get over the sad fact that the curry, the core dishes of Thai cuisine did not appear to be made in house and reminded us of canned products.

Best Thai food I have ever had. Better than Lotus of Siam in Vegas. Better than Jitlada or Night & Market Song in LA. Plus amazing wine pairing that the whole table loved (you know those wines where everyone wants to make sure they write down the name so they cam buy it again? Yeah, that good!). Dont be put off by the location -- we drove off the strip past strip plazas and mattress stores, thinking where the eff is this place? Lol. It's cute and cozy and hidden. There is a reason Vegas' top top Chefs come here to eat when they are off duty! Because it's fantastic.

This place is great. I've been here a handful of times and try to mix it up w/ what I order. Cool and relaxing atmosphere - candlelight w/ red/black decor. Solid wine, tasty food, good prices, and great service. Our waiter was Duane and he's on top of his stuff. Knowledgable and friendly.

Our once favorite Thai restaurant in town , easily able to cater to my vegan wife ! Hit or miss amazing food and staff..  I guess the chef left so it's taken some time for them to get the food back on point but tonight our food was amazing, I hope they continue to improve.  Staffs been attentive, glad they got back together .

Where do i begin! Been here a few times for dinner. ordered the beef jerky which was great as was the spicy herb spring roll, had the beef penang which was the best I ever had, also had the crispy beef with rice powder which was out of this world. They are consistent with their dishes which is key in my book. They actually use tea leaves in their hot tea not some tea bag out of the box! They also have a giant wine selection as well. Service was on point and fast.

This place is nice atmosphere, clean, relaxing and intimate. From the outside you would not know this gem exists. Definitely a date friendly place.

Forget about trying another Thai restaurant this is the place. I tried a bunch of them. Keep up the good work!!

Great food love the place and the concept with the wine and Great service 
Everytime that I eat that It's great just like the last time  
5 star from me

I ate here once when visiting Las Vegas. The food and service were great. I would highly recommend this restaurant. It is open until late which is great. I flew into Las Vegas 9:00 PM, checked in in my hotel, and still could have dinner at this place without rushing
Service was good and so was the ambiance. Delicious food but the three stars goes to the portion sizes. You'll have to hit a fast food joint or another restaurant afterwards.

Soooo flavorful and delicious!!!

I don't eat much in one sitting so small tapas style is my go-to. This place was soooo good!!!
Lots of flavors.
Good service.
Fresh.

Locals favorite!!

I cant recall most of the names we ordered but

The spring roll was GREAT!
Quail egg with dried shrimp dish was delicious!
Crab lettuce wrap was fresh and YUM!
Curry with noodles- very flavorful!
Sticky rice and mangoes were just OK, rice was kind of bland and dry.

This is the real deal: a gift to the Vegas food scene.

Chada is a restaurant that cares deeply about each dish, each diner, each evening, each experience, each moment.
It's a restaurant that understands the word "soupcon".....
Those are the qualities of an artist, and Bank (the owner) is an artist.

His wine list is blisteringly sophisticated and well-priced; a testament to how much the wholesale wine world loves him from his days at Lotus.

The food is positively poetic: delicate, thoughtful, harmonic, ethereal.

Yes, it's Thai food, but nothing that you've ever ever had.

If Thai food was a person, and it went on a walkabout with an angel of the universe, Chada's food would be the result.
I am not a food critic, but I know when I get a grewat meal and this really was one of the best Thai meals I have had here in Vegas. I will be back to try more dishes.

So this place is freakin amazing!!! We had the beef jerky, fried oysters, beef salad, and fried pork balls for appetizers and everything was phenomenal. Entrees were the pork belly and fried prawns. Pork belly was so flavorful. My favorite had to be the prawns though. We had the curry sauce on the side because my man doesn't like curry. I think that was a good decision though because I could dip my prawns in the most delicious curry I've ever had in my life!!! Just thinking about it now makes me want more!! Dessert was the honey toast. I think Ichiza's honey toast is better, but theirs is pretty darn close. 10/10 for sure. Beautiful, clean restaurant with great service. Couldn't ask for a better experience. I look forward to my next visit.

I've been reading and anticipating the opening of Chada for a few weeks.  From reading some online news I knew it was one the restaurants I must try.  So I was pleasantly surprised to see it open last Friday while driving past the area.  The owner I read is the sommelier of Lotus of Siam.  When we walked in, we could definitely see that was the case.  Wine bottle labels adorned the wall.  And a full wall of wine racks that still sit empty.  The restaurant feels new but they seem to be off to a good start.  Our waitress was very courteous and attentive throughout our meal, but you could tell she was new to her job.  The food arrived slowly.  We only were able to finish our chicken satay due to a flight to catch.  The satay was descent.  I thought the chicken looked more baked than grilled.  Pad mee prik kang we took to go.  It was a little more on the oily side but it was very tasty.  Although we were not impressed with our first visit we definitely would  return to try other dishes.

Surprised and saddened to have staff tell me Chada will be closing after dinner service this coming Saturday, May 26th.

I feel like service levels really dropped on more recent visits (which is also why I'm downgrading to 4*), but it's never nice to have a solid Thai option in Las Vegas close - especially not after the recent closure of Chada Street as well.

Much over due review! 

This is the best ever Thai in vegas, I don't care what anyone says! 

AppetiZer:
When available, their shrimp satee is the bomb!..their peanut sauce is my favorite 

Fresh spring rolls are the absolute best, most flavorful I've ever had

You have to try the Pork Larb

Main course:
Pad Z ew or pad Thai 
Panang curry with the most tender hangar steak 
Crab or lobster curry 
Charbroiled pork 
Moo Hong..pork belly
The most amazing Thai food I have ever had. I am going to make a trip back to Vegas so I can eat here again.
I've been to many Thai restaurants in my life including here in Vegas, LA, and elsewhere, and this is my all time favorite place for Thai food. You literally can't go wrong here.

I love Thai food, and I thought that I had found some of the best in the country at Lotus of Siam on Sahara. Then I discovered Chada, and it blew me away. It currently will sit at the top of my Thai list for the US, and I live on a Thai avenue in NYC. The food here is phenomenal. And it isn't just me who thinks so. I took foodies from NYC and LA to dinner with me, and we all agreed that it was the best Thai we've ever had. 

The chef came from Lotus, but here he moves beyond the traditional Thai offerings ... those are there on the menu too ... to more innovative Thai dishes. The restaurant is in a strange setting for visitors to Vegas who may not be too familiar with the Chinatown neighborhood. And I was still skeptical when I parked in the strip mall parking lot. But upon entering, I found a beautiful space and very friendly hosts and servers that created the perfect atmosphere for our group meal. 

Everything we tried was phenomenal. The soup was the best I've ever had in a Thai restaurant, and it came in a large bowl for sharing. but I'll have to say that my panang curry duck was unbelievable. It consists of small chunks of duck fried in a batter then covered in delicious panang curry. All of the curry dishes were excellent. The brussel sprouts were awesome. The Pad Thai is just right.

The server picked a perfect wine for our table, and he was responsive and prompt throughout our experience. Kudos to Chada. I'm coming back and telling everyone they must go.

I came here for a family birthday dinner and I'm giving this place a 5 for their food. I didn't really pay attention to service, but the food was really good. 

I separate Thai food in Las Vegas into three categories: 1. Standard and solid: these are affordable go to places that always get it right and are always satisfying. 
2. Below average: these are the random Thai places that you try once thinking how can someone mess up Thai food and leave without finishing your food and don't take the left overs to go.
3. Those above average Thai places that are elite Thai restaurants in Las Vegas that everyone knows about.

My mom is Thai and I get my Thai fix at home often, but not every dish made at home is restaurant quality. When I tried the spring rolls here it didn't remind me of a Thai dish, but it tasted like the epitome of Thai food. I think we got 4 orders of this. It was the perfect bite. Crunchy and soft texture with sweet, salty, and sour flavors.

Their Tom kha gai was also really good with perfect amount of broth to coconut milk and a good balance of sweet, sour, and spicy.

I also applaud the quality seafood they use. Big tiger prawns. Even in a "civilian" dish like pad Thai I thought they did very well. 

Then the mango sticky rice dessert at the end was perfect.

If I ever want to eat something my family doesn't make on the regular I'll definitely be back to Chada for their delicious food. Those spring rolls are a must try. 

If only they'd turn some lights on in there.

As I continued to hear buzz in local magazines about this place (for it has gotten some good write ups on the Vegas radar), my husband and I finally stopped in and I now understand what the buzz is all about.  The place is small, intimate and simple. Our waitress was lovely and quick to serve us.  Although they have many wines, only about 5 of those are by the glass, but a worthy bottle selection.  The 5 options by the glass are just OK.   We had fried oysters, drunken noodles, curry and sticky rice. Fried oysters were beautifully presented and curry was quite delicious.  All and all, really spectacular and we will be back!
Very good thai food. It tastes homemade. Spicy is appropriately spicy. The server told me a husband and wife own it and have combined family recipes to come up with their menu.

Enter at your own risk.  After waiting for twenty minutes, they served me overcooked goop of drunken noodles.  It was so bad that when I took my fork to eat,  the noodles were all stuck together.  And even after I complained, all the manager could say was "sorry".  This place is the definition of SORRY FOOD and SORRY CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

There are so many different menu choices that I urge you to try something you usually wouldn't get. My boyfriend and I ordered the drunken noodles and the SEN MEE KANG POU (crab curry.) The curry was really spicy and is served with dry noodles on the side that you mix together. 

The ambience is nice and dimly lit. They have a whole wall of wine bottles and wine labels photo framed. If I was an avid wine drinker, this would be a haven for me. 

Overall, the experience was great and the price was not bad at all. Totally affordable.

We came in late night about 1030pm because I saw that they were open late.  The dining area is modern and in red tones throughout. They have framed labels of fine wines on one wall which made it look classy.

I ordered the pad woon seen and it was really sour and way to spicy for a medium. I like to have a balance of the sweet, spicy, sour and salty, but this dish was lacking the sweet and salty. 

I was also able to taste the fried pork belly with greens and it was just fried Chinese roast pork. A bit disappointed with this one too as when I think of pork belly, I think of something a little more refined, tender and juicy. The pork was dry from the frying. 

I would come back to try other menu items but it's not on the top of my list. One day...

The restaurant is located near District One and China Mama. 
Once you enter, the ambience is modern, has dim lighting, and had a cool wine display.
The menu is unique and has different items than your regular Thai restaurant. For appetizer, we ordered their fried chicken. The portion is small but it was perfect since we ordered two other main entrees. The panang was delicious. It had great flavor. The slow cooked beef was very tender.  We also ordered a fried shrimp with a creamy sauce. Great flavor. Their curries are just as good as Lotus of Siam. Coming back to try other dishes. :)

It was almost everything I'd hoped it would be. Almost.

Chada Thai & Wine is widely regarded as one of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. Some even place it above the nationally renowned Lotus of Siam. I finally got to experience the upstart restaurant today. I knew from visits to the area that it's in a large plaza on the eastern edge of Jones between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn. Its sign is modest, so look for it in the middle of the plaza, between a karaoke place and a much more prominent District One.

Chada only offers dinner service, and the interior is appropriately dim. Despite my photos attached to this review, the colors were definitely muted by the low light. The restaurant is also relatively cozy, with not much more than forty seats available. Despite that, it wasn't crowded at all on a Wednesday night and we were seated promptly even without a reservation. I also love the alternative rock that they play in here (Muse, Imagine Dragons, Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros, and others), which makes this restaurant one of my favorites anywhere music-wise.

My mom and I were far more interested in the Thai than the Wine. We didn't get any alcohol, but we shared a number of dishes.

Kai Yang ($8.00): grilled marinated Cornish hen w/ spicy fish sauce. Moist chicken, nice spices, very sour sauce. Quite delicious, especially considering that it's just a chicken dish. Go easy on the sauce.

Panang Curry ($9.00): slow-cooked hanger steak in Panang curry. Rich coconut curry that still had quite a kick when ordered "mild" (results may vary, but I'm pretty sensitive to spicy foods). Delicious, tender beef. What more can you ask for?

Kana Moo Krob ($9.00): Chinese broccoli w/ so-called crispy pork belly. The Chinese broccoli was nice, and the sauce was also tasty. The pork belly was certainly not crispy as advertised. It was very tough to chew and a bit too salty, as if overcooked, and the pork belly skin that should've been crispy ended up being a sticky, chewy mess, as if it had been allowed to soak up the juices for a while. I don't know what happened here, but whether it's improper execution or something else, I'm really not sold on this thing.

Pad Kra Pow w/ sliced pork ($8.00): stir-fried meat w/ chili and Thai basil. It's a relatively sweet dish but doesn't go overboard. The pork is meaty and works well, but I wouldn't mind trying a premium protein (crispy duck, rib eye) or an equally inexpensive alternative (chicken, beef, ground pork) on a different occasion. Overall, not as impressive as the Kai Yang or the Panang Curry, but certainly better than the Kana Moo Krob.

Sides of rice ($1.50) and sticky rice ($2.50) complemented the tasty courses. They're reasonable portions for the cost. The regular rice is served in a bowl. The sticky rice is wrapped in plastic and served in a basket. No issues with either.

Prices were reasonable for the portions. We probably had one extra dish's worth at the end. Service was fine. Pacing could've been improved slightly. The kitchen had almost all the dishes come out at once, and probably would have gotten them all simultaneously had I not waited a few minutes on the Pad Kra Pow order. I would've rather had two dishes to dissect at a time rather than all four, so I'll have to remember to request that next time.

Based on tonight's experiences, I'll probably return to Chada Thai & Wine and delve deeper into their menu. I'll just be sure to skip the flawed pork dish.
Duck Panang was Bomb! I also enjoyed the fish with Ginger and Bok Choi. Get the Thai Sunday for dessert.

Our starters were fantastic I must say.    Very tasty.    We had cooked vegetarian spring rolls, pork rolls, made with lettuce.    Both were wonderful.   Very good.    Also had chicken coconut soup which was nice and subtle too.  

Then we had basil chicken, a noodle dish, crispy beef with tamarind sauce and a crab dish.   Basic was ok,   good not awesome.   Beef dish was not good at all.   Sour light sauce, not pleasant.  Noodle dish was alright.  

So a mix for this night.   Starters were great and mains just ok.
